Posting Title: 🤵🏻H&H Management in Fort Wayne is HIRING Shift Lead!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Dairy Queen | H&H Management is growing their team in Fort Wayne    Who Are We? For more than 70 years, the DQ® system's recipe for success has been simple. It's been a combination of hardworking people who own and operate restaurants, and great-tasting food and tempting treats served in our establishments. Our phenomenal story began with the 10-cent sale of a then unnamed product on August 4, 1938, in Kankakee, Illinois. A father and son partnership in Green River, Illinois, had been experimenting with a soft frozen dairy product for some time. They contacted Sherb Noble, a good friend and customer, who agreed to run the "all you can eat" trial sale at his walk-in ice cream store. Within two hours, he dished out more than 1,600 servings of the new dessert. Who Are We Looking For? Shift Lead We strive to create positive memories for all our fans so we are looking for positive, energetic employees who are passionate about the Dairy Queen brand and delivering exceptional customer (fan) service. If you enjoy working in a fun, fast paced environment while providing exceptional customer service, we would love to hear from you! Applicants should be eager to lead, do things right, be accountable, have ownership in what they do, and be able to create smiles and stories for our fans.Job Functions:Be an ambassador of the Dairy Queen brand and be professional in every aspect of performanceEnthusiastically greet and welcome fans to the Dairy Queen brandStrive to exceed fan expectations and deliver fan first service through timely and quality serviceAssist in the management of specific areas of the restaurant during scheduled shiftsPace the crew to high levels of performance by understanding the importance of speed ofservice and resolve bottlenecks in work flowAssist the GM and Assistant Manager(s) with training and coaching crew members to build ahighly skilled and productive teamEnsure that the restaurant is properly organized and staffedCreate and maintain a positive, safe, clean, and inviting environment for fans and teammembersCalmly solve fan concerns and embrace Dairy Queen’s service recovery standardsBe a willing team player and maintain a cooperative, harmonious working relationship withmanagement and team membersModels performance standards for all team members and work stationsAt all times exhibit a genuine passion for excellencePerform other duties as assigned by management      Come join our team today!

Posting Title: On Call Banquet Food Server - President Abraham Lincoln - HOT08XBC
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   The President Abraham Lincoln Springfield, a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel is set in the heart of historic downtown, Springfield, IL. Now seeking highly motivated people with a heart for service to join our Banquet team!  On-Call rotating schedules, starting as early as 5:30 a.m. or work evening shifts as late as 1:00 a.m. Weekends and holidays required. *Hours vary based on Banquet event needs*  Starting pay is $13.50 per hour!  APPLY RIGHT NOW! (It only takes a couple of minutes, use your phone) and a Hilton recruiter will be in touch.   What will I be doing? As a Banquet Server, you would be responsible for delivering and serving food and beverage items to guests in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:     Set banquet tables to meet function specifications Deliver and serve food and beverages, including, but not limited to, meals, condiments and accompaniments Ensure menu knowledge Remove china, glassware, silverware, etc. from tables at the conclusion of the meal period and deliver to the stewarding area Ensure guest satisfaction throughout the meal service Respond to guest requests in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner Assist fellow team members and other departments wherever necessary to maintain positive working relationships Assist others with side work including, but not limited to cleaning, stocking, folding silverware, etc. What are we looking for? Since being founded in 1919, Hilton has been a leader in the hospitality industry. Today, Hilton remains a beacon of innovation, quality, and success. This continued leadership is the result of our Team Members staying true to our Vision, Mission, and Values. Specifically, we look for demonstration of these Values:        Hospitality - We're passionate about delivering exceptional guest experiences. Integrity - We do the right thing, all the time. Leadership - We're leaders in our industry and in our communities. Teamwork - We're team players in everything we do. Ownership - We're the owners of our actions and decisions. Now - We operate with a sense of urgency and discipline  In addition, we look for the demonstration of the following key attributes:  Quality Productivity Dependability Customer Focus Adaptability  What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Posting Title: Head Chef - Full Mile Beer Co. & Kitchen
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   We are a busy, full-service, from-scratch restaurant and brewery in the heart of downtown Sun Prairie, WI (twenty minutes East of downtown Madison). Locally owned, with on-site, involved ownership. We offer a creative, pub style food menu with wood-fired pizzas and monthly featured menu items that allow for further creative development and flexing by our Head Chef. Paired with high-quality house-brewed beers, cocktails and a top-notch FOH staff in a modern, hip space, we offer a customer experience unlike any in the area. While the customer experience is paramount to our success, we cultivate a work culture that is inclusive, collaborative, fun and familial. Our open-kitchen concept allows for the wood-fired pizza oven as well as nearly all kitchen stations to be visible during service.  We are currently accepting resumes for an experienced, working Head / Executive Chef candidate to step in and lead our strong BOH team. We have an experienced, tight knit kitchen crew that excels at what they do, need a strong leader to manage and coordinate the team.  Working Head Chef Position  Ideal candidate: • 3+ years of head chef or kitchen manager experience • 8+ years of overall commercial kitchen experience – understands all kitchen stations and is proficient in each • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and sometimes high-pressure environment • Team player with the ability to work and communicate with managers and staff from both FOH and BOH • Passion for creative cooking • Wood-fired pizza experience nice but not necessary • The ability to problem-solve and work well under pressure • Excellent communication and teaching / training skills • Holds themselves and team to high standards and works to achieve and surpass those standards daily • Understands the importance of the overall customer experience and the kitchen’s part in that experience • Embraces administrative side of position as well as culinary side • Knowledge of food preparation and existing health and safety standards • Ability to effectively supervise, manage, direct, and lead a team of around 14 individuals • Time management strengths with the ability to multi-task • Scratch kitchen experience • Familiarity with best practices in the industry • Must be available to work weekends and evenings or other shifts as necessary • Competent computer skills and ability to learn more if necessary • ServSafe certification  Job duties: • Lead, supervise and manage all BOH employees • Menu creation in conjunction with management • Work any kitchen station as necessary • Maintain and manage food quality standards and recipe adherence • Interview, hire and train BOH personnel. Conduct performance reviews and staff check-ins and meetings • Coordinate cross-training activities and menu training with FOH and BOH staff • Develop process/training plan(s) for BOH and implement as necessary • Responsible for BOH staff promotions and disciplinary actions • Maintain impeccable safety and sanitation standards • Manage labor, labor scheduling and labor costs • Manage food and product ordering by keeping detailed records and minimizing waste • The ability to execute all daily operations to include but not limited to; prep, line production or cooking, wood-fired oven production and cooking, shift execution, ordering, recipe adherence, and recipe development. • Maintain diligent record-keeping and report to management / owners in a timely manner  Benefits: • Health, vision and dental insurance available after 30 days. Employer pays 50% of monthly health (Quartz) insurance premiums • Simple 401k account (coming after Jan. 1) • Bonuses when warranted • Free daily meal and drink

Posting Title: Experience Guide | Holly Jolly Holiday Bar at Electric Garden | Now Hi
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Culinary Agents is working with the team at Holly Jolly Holiday Bar at Electric Garden to connect them with talented hospitality professionals.  Holly Jolly Holiday Bar at Electric Garden - Now Hiring: Experience Guide Click here to learn more & apply today!     About Us   Bucket Listers in the go-to destination for inspiring experiences. Our loyal community of explorers turns to us for inspiration, local exploration and to book unique experiences.   We've set out to do great things and we're looking for passionate team members to join us on our mission. We're explorers ourselves who are passionate about spreading positivity and providing inspiration for people to experience more out of life together.   The Opportunity   The Bucket Listers team is spreading a whole lot of cheer this holiday season in Chicago. From Piano Bars to immersive winter wonderlands, we’ll be inspiring guests to sing a little louder and sparkle a little brighter this season.    In order to ensure that our guests have an incredible experience (each and every time), we are looking for jolly and joyful team members to join our seasonal hospitality team. You’ll meet and greet guests, work closely with our venue partners and act as the face of the Bucket Listers brand (...and maybe even join in on some caroling).   Responsibilities Include:   Checking in guests in at our holiday experiences. Greeting guests with holiday cheer. Collaborating with our vendors and internal teams. Provide feedback to continuously improve our experiences. Bring the Bucket Listers brand to life by inspiring experiences with your passion and zest for the holiday spirit!      The not-so-fine-print:   This is an hourly, part-time position located in Chicago. The position will be on-site at one of our holiday experiences in the West Loop of Chicago. All guides must be available for an on-site interview and on-site training prior to their first shift. This opportunity will run from November 2022 through January 2023 Hourly Rate: $16-17/hr        Bucket Listers is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team.         Create your FREE profile on CulinaryAgents.com to apply to any job with a single click! Plus, start receiving alerts for new opportunities that match your skills and experience.

Evening Bar is a comfortable, classic American bar serving seasonally crafted cocktails and bar bites. Posting Title: Skilled Cook | Soho House Chicago | Now Hiring
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Culinary Agents is working with the team at Soho House Chicago to connect them with talented hospitality professionals.  Soho House Chicago - Now Hiring: Skilled Cook Click here to learn more & apply today!   ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT COOKING?We are looking for a Skilled Cook to join our team at SOHO HOUSE CHICAGO.Who We Are...Soho House is a collection of private members' clubs and restaurants spread throughout Europe, The UK, America, and Asia. Each house and restaurant maintains its own personality and atmosphere but the ethos has remained the same; serving fantastic cocktails and simple but delicious food in a comfortable and relaxed environment.The Venue...Housed in a 1907 warehouse in the fashionable Randolph Market area, the six-story building was originally the manufacturing center of the Chicago Belting Factory and includes many original features such as ornamented entrance lobby and exposed concrete. The House includes 40 bedrooms, a full-sized pool, screening room, gym, and a glass-enclosed rooftop bar & kitchen. The team… Our Culinary Management team are leaders curating experiences through food while overseeing kitchen department. The team prides themselves in collaborating with local farms and producers. Food first and focused on delivering seasonally influenced and innovative dishes in fast paced environment without scarifying quality results. Our team of passionate chefs develop their teams to grow and deliver consistency in fast-paced and demanding environments. The role… A Skilled Cook is responsible for the daily preparation of food items in the pantry, fry and/or stations or other areas of the kitchen. As a Skilled Cook, you thrive in fast-paced environments and positively influence the team by demonstrating highly skilled abilities of two stations as well as remaining calm during a busy service. Daily responsibilities also include preparation of food items in the pantry, fry station, and other areas of the kitchen as well as adhering to allergy requests and specific alterations to dishes. A successful Skilled Cook is a critical member of the team due to the focused and appreciated culinary abilities. A Skilled Cook is hyper-specialized and has proven ability to execute all menu items properly from prep to plate and deliver top quality dishes.   Main Duties  Responsible for following ingredients on all menu items and able to produce consistent and quality dishes in fast-paced and demanding environments and on two stations Assist with inventory to support the kitchen operating at a sustainable food cost Watch wastage, cooking temps and quality to reduce additional costs, influence others on the cost of product and how it contributes to the profit and loss of the company Production and a-la-carte dish(s) execution. Including weekend feast ideas and family meal. Work towards specific goals and Soho House Standards for speed of service goals and consistent experience for Soho House Standards for service; 3-8-10 Delegate some tasks as needed while also ensuring proper procedure is followed when clocking in and out for shifts as well as breaks Support Executive Sous and Jr. Sous with pre and post service meeting as well as follows recipes, portion controls, and presentation specifications as set by the Kitchen as well as restocks all items as needed throughout shift Positive influence for teams under pressure and provide a welcoming work environment that increases staff moral Attend “Cook House” trainings and support the mentoring and education of new and existing team members on areas they are looking to go Prepares all food items ads directed in a sanitary and timely manner and sets up station according to Kitchen guidelines and maintains a safe, clean, organized, and stocked work area Assists with the cleaning, sanitation, and organization of kitchen, walk-in coolers, and all storage areas and Commitment to quality service and food knowledge. In addition to the ability to comply with safety, sanitation, and food handling procedures   Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor/manager.  Required Skills/Qualifications  Minimum of 4+ years’ experience in a fast-paced, upscale, and approachable environment of professionals Strong understanding of professional cooking and knife handling skills Proven ability to execute all menu items and properly prepare and deliver top quality dishes on all stations Food handler’s certificate Strong communicator, able to take direction, team player and motivator Proactive ability to build professional relationships with all leaders and kitchen team and arrive to work prior to scheduled start to ensure you have appropriate time to situate, eat and be briefed on previous service and anticipated service Flexible schedule and ability to work morning, night, weekend, and holiday’s (as needed) Possess a level of creativity to create recipes from scratch    Physical Requirements  Must be able to seize, grasp, turn and hold objects with hands. Must be able to make periodical fast paced movements are required to go from one part of the property to others. Must be able to move, pull, carry, or lift at least 20 pounds. Must be able to occasionally kneel, bend, crouch and climb is required. Must be able to perform physical activities such as lifting, cleaning, and stooping. Must be able to stand, walk, lift, and bend for long periods of time. Must be able to bend, stoop, lift, reach, push, twist, walk, crouch, and squat.    Why work with us... Soho House offers competitive compensation packages that feature global benefits and perks. Whether you’re seeking entry-level employment or a new opportunity to expand your profession, we offer training to develop the technical and managerial skills necessary to enhance your career.    Health Care + 401K: Full time employees are eligible for full benefits; Medical, Dental & Vision as well as Retirement fund with a 2% match Paid Time Off: Full- Time Employees have sick day's + vacation days Career Development: Soho House can progress your career domestically or internationally as well as managerially or technically Soho Impact: Empowering the Soho House Community to make positive change, through mentoring, apprenticeship, local outreach, and sustainability Learning & Development: An extensive range of internally and externally run courses are available for all employees. Cookhouse & House Tonic: Celebrating our passion for food and drink. Check out our monthly calendars and get involved in trips, trainings, and events. Available to all. Team Events: From fitness sessions to cinema screenings and art classes, each month we hold a series of fun events which you can sign up to.  Team Meal: Whilst on duty in our Houses & Restaurants you will be provided with a substantial meal free of charge.   Create your FREE profile on CulinaryAgents.com to apply to any job with a single click! Plus, start receiving alerts for new opportunities that match your skills and experience.

Burger and Sushi House was established in 2013 based on the idea of bringing everyone to the table. We offer a unique pairing of quality food, service, and ambience. Our staff ranges from local familiar faces to a team of sushi chefs with experience from across the world. B.A.S.H. has been open for 9 years and growing into a second location very soon!  We are looking for a Sushi Chef who possesses the following qualities:  · Prior experience in a Sushi Chef position  · Minimum of 1 year experience as a Sushi Chef in restaurant  · Ensure highest quality food preparations, hygiene standards, and strong attention to detail  · Expert in cutting, slicing, and filleting different types of fish  · Ensure that all food and products are consistently prepared and served according to the restaurant’s recipes, portioning, cooking and serving standards  · Monitor inventory and supplies  · Ability to stand for extended periods of time  · Excellent communication skills  · Embody our core values  · Demonstrate skills to motivate and continue developing a high performing team  · Have an eye for detail and creativity  At B.A.S.H. we pride ourselves in warm hospitality and chef-driven mentality, empowering our teams by putting our people first, hands-on mentorship, and a creative culture. B.A.S.H. serves an array of sushi dishes from signature rolls, raw fish, unique sharing plates, as well as gourmet burgers, accompanied by a wine and cocktail menu to accommodate any celebration. Posting Title: Full-Time Night Auditor - Lincoln Park Hostel
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Chicago Getaway Hostel  POSITION:  Front Desk Agent  Chicago Getaway Hostel is currently looking to hire a Full-time Night Auditor.    Required shifts:  11p - 7a (5 nights per week)  Chicago Getaway Hostel is located in Lincoln Park - Chicago's best neighborhood.  You can walk to the beach, Lincoln Park Zoo, or go for a run on the 18-mile running path along the lake.    Front Desk Agents at Chicago Getaway Hostel are responsible for providing all guests with an awesome check-in and check-out experience and ensuring they are equipped to explore the city in the most cost effective and dynamic way possible.  We are looking for Front Desk Agents who are great multi-taskers, love interacting with people from all across the globe and whom have open availability.    Some of the key job responsibilities include:   •	Welcoming guests and offering luggage support as/if necessary. •	Provide sufficient guest registration, check out and telephone service. •	Acting as the "local expert" for Concierge-related inquiries and requests. •	Booking guests services including but not limited to car service, city tours, etc. •	Discuss and resolve any guest issue before, during or after their stay. •	Oversee all public areas and ensure all spaces remain in immaculate condition. •	Ensure an awesome vibe at all times -- music, lighting, cleanliness, fun, etc.   If this sounds like something that makes you want to rock out with us, then drop us your resume.   Chicago Getaway Hostel believes strongly in artistic expression and individuality. Along with your resume, we welcome you to send us a photo (or link to photos via FB/IG) that best represents how you express your individuality!    REQUIREMENTS:  We are looking for...  Punctual people &  detail-oriented folks Positive attitudes Common-sense thinkers Unique and/or stylish people  who are also...    Honest Abe's  Resourceful Low drama    . . .And if you have 1-2 years of hotel operations experience, that's really amazing!  Chicago Getaway Hostel is an EOO.

We are looking for a Full Time & Part Time Roles    Description:    Crust ǀ Line Cook:  • Fenton, MI 48430   • $14/hr + tips    We Offer:   • Referral bonus- Refer an employee, and receive a $75 referral bonus if they remain employed for 60+ days       • Payroll treats every pay day (free bread or pastry)                                            • Full-time (30+ hours per week) eligible staff members                                     • Aflac- short-term disability, cancer protection, accident coverage   Crust is a baking company that has been established in Fenton, Michigan since 2012. The Crust restaurant serves breakfast and lunch Tuesday through Sunday from 8 AM to 4 PM. We would be interested in speaking with any and all interested candidates about this opportunity (regardless of experience level) but line cook or food handling experience is a plus! Weekend and morning/afternoon availability is required in order to be considered for a back-of-house position with Crust.   Job requirements:   • Prepare menu and food prep items according to Crust specifications and guidelines   • Maintain cleanliness of station and surrounding areas including storage areas and surfaces   • Abides by Crust’s company policies and standards for quality, cleanliness, teamwork, etc.   • Communicates with other departments within the bakery including front of the house, management, etc.   • Ensure productive use of time for the duration of an 8-hour shift      Apply now by clicking the "reply" button to email us!

Posting Title: ▶Cook, Dishwasher, Host, More◀ The Cheesecake Factory - Columbus
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post    HIRING IMMEDIATELY Line Cook || Prep Cook || Dishwasher  Host || Server || Cashier || Barista/Dessert Finisher || Busser Applicants must be 18 years old or older. The Cheesecake Factory 3975 Townsfair Way -- Columbus, OH 43219 Located at East Town Center.   APPLY HERE What we offer: Flexible scheduling Training Health benefits including medical, dental and vision (after 25 hours/week average) Paid time off (after 25 hours/week average) Discounted shift meals 25% discount for your party when dining in as a guest Career growth opportunities Who we are Since 1978, we’ve been known for our legendary cheesecakes, upscale casual hospitality and fresh-from-scratch menu, but we’re most proud of being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list since 2014. With 45,000 staff members across more than 300 restaurants – including The Cheesecake Factory, North Italia, Grand Lux Cafe, Social Monk and Fox Restaurant concepts – our people-centered culture offers something for everyone.  We are an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming workplace for all. We welcome applicants from a wide variety of identities, ideas, perspectives and experiences and encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. The Cheesecake Factory offers reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities.  #LifeatCheesecake #soCheesecake Our Safety Commitment Our top priority is to ensure the health and wellbeing of our staff, managers and guests by following the guidance of the CDC and local health departments.

Posting Title: Texas Roadhouse - Kitchen Manager - Springfield, IL
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Do you want to love your job? Join the Texas Roadhouse family and take pride in your work!Texas Roadhouse is looking for a legendary Kitchen Manager. As a Kitchen Manager, you would oversee all Back of House operations and be responsible for purchasing, receiving, preparing, and presenting all food products in a timely manner, according to established recipes, and procedures. If you have a passion for made-from-scratch food, apply to be a Kitchen Manager at Texas Roadhouse today!As a Kitchen Manager, your responsibilities would include:• Supervising and overseeing the production and preparation of food in a manner consistent with established recipes and procedures• In conjunction with all Management, enforcing compliance with all employment policies and overseeing cleanliness of restaurant and safety of guests at all times• Directing productivity to monitor and maintain efficient and effective food item ticket times• Managing performance of Back of House employees, including conducting performance evaluations, coaching, and discipline• Assisting with the development of all Key Hourly employees, Assistant Managers, and Hourly employees by providing daily feedback on performance during one-on-ones• Conducting formal line Taste & Temp checks as part of overall responsibility for inventory and safety in the kitchen• Overseeing the proper handling, maintenance, and storage of all items• Understanding, managing, and practicing safe food handling procedures• Managing food costs, tracking waste, and controlling kitchen labor costs• Directing work for kitchen employees, including setting hours and weekly schedules and assigning tasks before, during and after open hours of the restaurant• Training Back of House staff on equipment maintenance and cleaning procedures• Reviewing applications, interviewing, and hiring or making recommendation to hire Back of House employees• Creating a safe, fun, and clean work environment for the staff in a manner consistent with our core values and operational goalsAt Texas Roadhouse we have a fun culture with flexible work schedules, discounts in our restaurants, friendly competitions, recognition, formal training, and career growth opportunities.We offer a comprehensive total rewards package after 30 days of employment to Restaurant Managers that meet our benefit eligibility requirements. The total rewards package includes, but is not limited to, the following:• A choice of medical plans that are best in class• Dental and Vision Insurance• Paid Vacation, Parental, Donor, Bereavement and 100% Paid Maternity Leave• Adoption Assistance• Short-Term and Long-Term Disability• Life, Accident and Critical Illness Insurance• Identity Theft Protection• Employee Assistance Program• Business Travel Insurance• 401(k) Retirement Plan• Flexible Spending Accounts• Tuition Reimbursements up to $5,250 per year• Monthly Profit Sharing Program• Quarterly Restricted Stock Units Program• Many opportunities to support your community• Annual holiday bonusWe are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, or any other legally-protected status. We encourage and welcome all applicants to apply.Requirements:For more information about this position, please contact the restaurant and ask for a manager.Apply Now

Posting Title: Hiring Servers for Forte at Symphony Center
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Position Title: Server - Forte @ Symphony Center (opening soon!)  Starting Pay: $10.24 per hour, plus pooled tips  We Make Applying Easy!  Want to apply to this job via text messaging?  Text JOB to 75000 and search requisition ID number 1115178.  (The advertised program is an AI recruiting assistant that helps you apply to jobs with Compass Group. Message and data rates may apply. Text STOP to opt-out or HELP for help. )  Diversity of thought and inclusion for all drives our success - we invite you to start your journey with us today!  Are you looking for a job with competitive wages, one in which you can learn and grow and be a part of a great team?  We're hiring!  Great team member perks like Instapay (early access to your wages) and high-interest savings both through the EVEN app.  From the stadium to the head table, Levy leverages unbridled creativity, custom strategies, impeccable service, and true love for great food to create unforgettable experiences. Founded in Chicago 40 years ago as a Delicatessen, Levy now finds itself as a leading presence in the Food, Beverage, and Retail industry across 200 plus Entertainment, Sports, and Restaurant venues across the country.  Forte at Symphony Center offers fresh and inspired menus anchored by the hearth oven with braised and roasted savory counterparts, as well as a global wine list & classic cocktail menu. We offer elevated contemporary service in the main dining room, with a casual bar environment for the bar and outdoor patio   Positions at this location will require a COVID-19 vaccination. Where permitted by law, applicants who are offered a position for this account may be asked about their vaccination status, which must meet minimum business requirements. All religious, medical, or other legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.  Job Summary Forte Restaurant Server Summary:  Takes food and beverage orders and efficiently delivers items to dining room guests.    Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Promptly and warmly greet guests in the dining room; takes food and beverages in an efficient manner, following established steps of service. Delivers food promptly and professionally; maintains safe food handling and sanitation standards. Follows up periodically to assist with any additional needs or requests. Demonstrates a complete understanding of menu items and ingredients. Advises guests on appropriate combinations of food and drinks when requested; accommodates reasonable requests and notes preferences. As needed, demonstrates knowledge of specialized diets and allergens. Communicates directly with back-of-the-house staff to ensure that orders are delivered correctly and special requests are accommodated. Exhibits exceptional communication skills and demonstrates the ability to get along well with others. Remains flexible and patient when communicating with guests and staff. Collects tickets and follows proper cash-handling procedures. Promotes a clean, safe and neat environment for guests. Maintains a high level of sensitivity and confidentiality regarding shared personal or medical information. Promptly addresses complaints or issues; relays relevant information or complaints directly to supervisor. Ensures that the dining room is properly set up prior to and after the service period; keeps area clean and neat while meeting established sanitation standards. Operates various equipment, including telephones, iced tea/soda machines, soup wells and coffee machines. Works with staff of other departments to perform job duties during special events and functions. Performs other duties as assigned. Suggesting additional items that can be paired with entrees based on ingredients or flavor profiles to increase sales Explaining the menu and specials to customers and answering any questions they may have about them Providing outstanding customer service to each guest by answering questions about the menu, making recommendations, and suggesting food and beverage pairings based on individual preferences and tastes Taking orders and serving alcoholic beverages to guests who are of legal age to drink in accordance with state liquor laws Tableside wine service Properly coursing orders for timely service  Required Certifications & Licenses   ServSafe Food Handler Certification, BASSETT Certification    Apply to Levy today!  Levy is a member of Compass Group USA  Compass Group is an equal-opportunity employer.  At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.  Associates of Levy are offered many fantastic benefits.  Instapay (early access to your wages) and high-interest savings both through the EVEN app Associate Shopping Program Health and Wellness Program Discount Marketplace Employee Assistance Program

Posting Title: Hiring for incredible new baker/ chef at Deli startup!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Zeitlin's Delicatessen is a Jewish Deli that uses the city of Chicago as our inspiration.  Started by two brothers, Zeitlin’s focusses on classic Ashkenazi Jewish cuisine using local produce, grains, and ingredients.  The team just grew into a new commissary kitchen on the south west side and are looking to growing.  We are going to one day have our own Jewish Deli brick and mortar, bakery, and are eager to feed the needy.  Here is an average day right now at the Deli!  A Day in the life at Zeitlin's :  Wake up and feel good (knowing you are coming here!) Come to work. Bake some seriously delicious bagels and sourdough bread.  Package them up to be delivered all over the city! Pause to nosh a bagel while drinking some coffee. Roll into prepping knishes (while practicing how to pronounce them). Make some delicious salads and tasty sandwiches! Clean some dishes (perhaps the only non-happy task?) Have a well-deserved and tasty lunch with the team! Plan out the second half of the day! And that's it. Break down, and have a great rest of your day. Job Description:   Zeitlin’s is looking for a baker/cook to join the team!  We are looking for someone with a great attitude, a kind heart, and strong work ethic.  Being on time is important and we value integrity across the board.  We bake, cook, and produce top quality food and desire to showcase the beauty of the Jewish Deli.  Early mornings are mandatory.  Full time and part time work available.  Looking for people to grow with the Deli.    Overview: The team member role iis in charge of producing and maintaining exceptional quality of bread, bagels, and prepared foods.  The cooks role will be to possess proficient cooking and baking skills while maintaining an organized station.  The team member will be responsible for weighing out recipes, organizing the kitchen, and preparing Zeitlin’s food related items, from sourdough bread, fresh bagels, pastries, salads, deli meats, entrees, and much more.  The team member will report to the baking manager and owner. Above all, the team member must do all to contribute to a positive work environment as set forth by the culture and values of Zeitlin's Delicatessen.  Essential Job Functions:  Food  Weigh out, prepare, and organize food to be sold at markets and wholesale Communicate with the manager of product needs related to menu items Follow the managers directions to execute food at the highest level. Prep food products according to weekly orders.   Lead the staff in following the standards for proper food handling  Use proper rotation, first in first out, checking for quality, preventing food waste  Health & Safety  Contribute to the general cleanliness of the kitchen and the equipment Observe good sanitation practices and safety procedures at all times  Employee Relations  Cultivate and maintain professional work relationships with all other employees through a positive and team-driven work effort Contribute on a regular basis to providing organizational support Communicate clearly and professionally with other employees inventory and mise en place Assist the Chefs in managing stations Other Requirements  Understand how to use, operate, and care for all kitchen equipment. Check out with the supervising chef at the end of each shift to communicate any issues or needs the chef needs to be aware of Arrive as scheduled for shifts and all meetings Maintain uniform cleanliness and proper attire at all times without exception Experience / Skills:  High school diploma encouraged Proficient knife-skills Excellent knowledge of cooking terms, techniques, and recipes Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. Serve Safe Food Handlers Certificate required Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals, and recipes.  Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or fellow employees. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk, and hear.  The employee frequently is required to sit, reach with hands and arms.  Cultivate and maintain professional relationships with all employees through a positive and team-driven work effort  Reach out to sam@zeitlinsdeli.com for more info!

Our ideal Food Service Supervisor excels at the following:  •	Passionate about food and service  •	Has a solid understanding of food handling regulations  •	Desire to always learn more  •	Ability to work as a team member, as well as independently  •	Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly  •	Dependable and flexible    Essential Functions/Core Responsibilities  •	Supervise inmate labor and/or team members in the kitchen during food prep and food service shifts in the kitchen.  •	Prepare, assist, or instructs inmate labor and/or team members in the preparation of quality foods according to the planned menu, recipes, and work instructions in a timely manner.  •	Ensure that all food is stored properly and in sanitary manner.  •	Serve food during planned meal schedules and according to department policies and procedures.  •	Utilize kitchen utensils/equipment to cook, prepare and serve food according to recipes.  Use proper utensils to serve menued portions and as appropriate to meet clients’ nutritional needs.  •	Follow all food safety regulations pertaining to sanitation, food handling and storage.  •	Train other food service workers.  •	Maintain a clean work area/environment that includes cleaning of refrigerators and/or freezers, cooking equipment and serving equipment.  •	Follow facility uniform policy. •	Keep up with garbage collection and keep kitchen floors clean from excess food/trash.  •	Ensure kitchen is kept clean and that the environment is ready for food prep/serving including sweeping, mopping and dishwashing. •	Proper portions and utensils are being reviewed for service. •	Promote a healthy and safe work environment for other employees/inmates.   •	This role includes physical demands such as lifting, bending, pushing, kneeling, walking, and standing for extended periods of time. •	Be able to stand and be on your feet for much of the scheduled shift.  •	Perform other related duties as assigned.   Required:  o	High School Diploma or Equivalent, and you must be at least 18 years of age. o	Ability to pass pre-employment (post offer) Company or Facility background check and drug screening and any other screenings required by the Facility. Posting Title: Front Waiter | Le Select | Now Hiring
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Culinary Agents is working with the team at Le Select to connect them with talented hospitality professionals.  Le Select - Now Hiring: Front Waiter Click here to learn more & apply today!  Boka Restaurant Group and James Beard Award winning/Michelin-starred chef, Daniel Rose, are excited to announce their newest restaurant opening, Le Select! Le Select will be opening soon as BRG’s first French brasserie, located in Chicago’s bustling River North! They are currently seeking Front Waiters to join their team!    BENEFITS & PERKS: Health, Dental, and Voluntary Benefits Package (available after 90 days), employer-sponsored mental health and resource program, 401(k) program, wellness benefits, paid sick leave, career mentorship and growth potential, and dining incentives across our 20+ establishments!         ABOUT BOKA RESTAURANT GROUP: Boka Restaurant Group is a James Beard Award-winning group, anchored by partnerships with some of American’s greatest chefs. With a firm belief that genuine hospitality makes the world a more human place, we strive beyond convention to believe in and support each other, care for our communities, and work together to build the world we want to live in. View our restaurants here: https://www.bokagrp.com/     ABOUT LE SELECT: Inspired by Chicago's commerce, architecture, and sophisticated no-nonsense sensibility, Le Select is a brasserie helmed by Michelin-starred chef Daniel Rose, known for articulating classic French cuisine as an homage to locality, heritage, and season.    FRONT WAITER’S RESPONSIBILITIES:   Accountable for the accurate & professional maintenance of all tables while providing exceptional guest service  Prepare the service stations for service based on restaurant standards ensuring the proper flow of service. Stock service stations with all service and n/a beverage items based on prescribed PARs Follow steps of service to provide a quality guest dining experience Provide proper food and beverage service adhering to restaurant standards Always follow proper sanitation practices Responsible for completing all opening, mid-shift, and closing procedures in a timely manner    QUALIFICATIONS:   Maintain all required health and sanitation certificates Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Interpersonal skill    This is an ideal position for someone who is dedicated to providing great service and is seeking to become a member of a hard-working and fun team!    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:   Lift and move up to 10 pounds; frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds; and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds Safely and effectively use all necessary tools, equipment, and cleaning chemicals Stand and walk for an entire shift, including moving safely through all areas of the restaurant which may include stairs, uneven, and/or slick surfaces Ability to bear exposure to hot and cold environments    If you feel you meet the requirements, are a team player, experienced, passionate, and dedicated to your craft, we want to hear from you!  Please reply with a copy of your resume AND a cover letter detailing why you'd be a great addition to our team!     Create your FREE profile on CulinaryAgents.com to apply to any job with a single click! Plus, start receiving alerts for new opportunities that match your skills and experience.

Posting Title: Full Time 2nd Shift Cooks in Walkers Point!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   ** $250 Hiring Bonus**     Saz's Catering Inc. is preparing to kick off another incredible seasons of events, and we're seeking 2nd shift cooks (2pm - 10pm) at all levels to help ensure we're delivering The Finest food to our guests!      Depending on your background and skills, we have positions available for Prep Cooks, who will prepare foods in our production kitchen in advance of catering events, Production Cooks, who will work at our facility and on-site at events, setting up mobile kitchens, preparing food items for service or carving food to order and Chefs de Partie, who will lead shifts of culinary team members at our permanent and event facilities, client venues and ensure the highest standards of food production through management of labor and food in a kitchen supervisory role.      All culinary team members are responsible for the cleanliness and upkeep of the kitchen, and the appropriate stocking, rotation and labeling of food products.      On-the-job training will be provided to ensure you're up to speed on our menus and procedures, but prior experience in production, mobile or banquet kitchen is required.     A variety of positions are available to accommodate your experience. Entry level Prep Cooks earn at least $14/hr. Production Cooks start no lower than $15.50 and Chefs de Partie earn at least $20/hr and all wages increase based on experience.     Scheduled hours may increase based on volume of events. Flexibility and weekend availability is required!    We're proud to be a five-time recipient of the Top Workplace award, and we want to show you why! Saz's Hospitality Group is thrilled to offer a variety of benefits to full-time employees, including health, dental and vision insurance, paid time off and a variety of discounts and partner programs. QR Code Link to This Post   Saz’s Hospitality Group is looking to add an experienced Event Operations Manager to its leadership team to serve at the helm of Sazama’s Fine Catering. Housed in Marcus Performing Arts Center, the area’s premier venue for musical, dance and theater performances, Sazama’s is the exclusive food and beverage provider for all private event and public-facing spaces. Situated on the city’s popular Riverwalk, this unique property features indoor and outdoor spaces to accommodate groups from 25-300 guests and concessions for event-goers of all ages.      The Event Operations Manager will work closely with the Food & Beverage Director, Marcus Performing Arts Center Management and Saz’s Hospitality Group leadership to ensure industry leading hospitality for events and functions at the Marcus Center. As an extension and ambassador of MPAC & SHG, this member will be expected to uphold the highest of standards and lead our teams with an ownership approach. Our EOM will ensure hospitality excellence & profitability by providing excellent training, clear direction & communication along with consistent feedback.    Overall Duties & Expectations:  Act as event lead to ensure successful execution of all types of catering events including larger or complex events, new clients, formal weddings, new business, repeat and smaller events Direct pre-event shift meetings prior to every event to inform team of event-specific details and their roles Provide direction, guidance and training to Captains and FOH team members Provide performance feedback on captains, servers and bartenders to conduct performance reviews Staff all functions with front of house staff including captains, servers and bartenders based on event needs Deliver performance coaching and policy action as necessary Establish a positive work environment for event execution teams Serve as on-site point of contact for clients and vendors Participate in Management Meetings in order to correct issues, learn and share new ideas within the company Attend BEO meetings to collaborate with Operations, Sales and Culinary staff on event details Collaborate with the Director of F&B, Saz’s Hospitality Group leadership in development of the Sazama's Fine Catering FOH Training Program Functional Tasks:  Proactively address client needs and feedback; handle complaints and oversee the service recovery procedures Use BEO details to ensure appropriate set up and service of events Use Staffmate and Caterease software Order, maintain and monitor inventory  Collaborate with Sales & Planning team to ensure client vision and needs for event are satisfied Work with Event Planner to coordinate operations details of event execution Coordinate with Staffing Coordinator to ensure personnel requests are met for each event Contribute to recruitment and hiring process for line level employees Provide performance feedback and coaching to team members on site to uphold standards and provide The Finest experience. Serve as lead trainer for new employees; complete orientation and training shifts according to FOH Training Program Lead event teams in setup and teardown of events Instruct team in process of food preparation/plating and service Oversee Bar & Banquet Captains to ensure appropriate execution and quality in all aspects of event  This leader will earn a competitive salary of no less than $60,000, depending on experience, and will be eligible to earn bonus opportunities for reaching established targets.  Saz's Hospitality Group is thrilled to offer a variety of benefits to full-time employees, including health, dental and vision insurance, paid time off and a variety of discounts and partner programs. All team members are eligible to enroll in HealthiestYou 24/7/365 telemedicine plan with monthly premiums paid 100% by Saz's after 60 days on the team and can participate in our 401(k) retirement plan with company match after working 1000 hours and free work shoes from our partners at Shoes for Crews!    This role is also eligible for a $2000 hiring bonus paid in segments throughout the first year on the team!     Requirements To be successful in this role, candidates will need to have recent event operational management experience in an event, banquet or similar role. A valid and unexpired ServSafe or Food Manager certification and City of Milwaukee bartenders’ license must be obtained and maintained at all times.    Essential job functions include:   Stand, walk or sit up to 12 hours at a time  Climb stairs, frequently while carrying items  Lift up to 50 lbs to chest level  Communicate verbally and in writing in English  Operate a computer to access the internet and work proficiently within a variety of software programs   Apply Today: https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/Apply/1400952/SAZAMAS-FINE-CATERING-INC/Event-Operations-Manager  We are an equal opportunity employer and fully subscribe to the principles of equal opportunity. Posting Title: Seeking Reps to Offer Restaurants/Small Business Grant Funding Now
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Our national company is seeking individuals who will connect with Restaurants and other small businesses, offering them direct funding (not a loan) due to the availability of the Employment Retention Credit (ERC) program. Many Restaurants, hair salons, gyms, etc. do not yet realize that even if they were profitable during the lockdown and/or received PPP, they still most likely qualify for very substantial ERC payments.  First, see this 5-minute sum-up Vimeo, read the figures below the video, and see the link whereby Restaurants apply directly with Jorns and Associates:  https://www.jornscpa.com/snap/?refid=10902748  If you feel you could market this program to small businesses up to 500 employees, return email back again mentioning a little about your background experience, especially in communications and sales.  Sincerely, Richard Byquist Founding Member Ref ID 10902748

Posting Title: Food Service Worker / General Utility Worker
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   We are hiring Food Service Workers & General Utility Workers in Ann Arbor and Saline!  Food Service Worker: The Food Service Worker position is vital to achieving excellent customer service in dining locations. The Food Service Workers are responsible for the line display, cooking food according to recipes, and making a one-on-one connection with the customer.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: • Maintain a clean and neat work station • Clean and sanitize work areas, equipment, and utensils • Utilize proper food handling procedures and food safety knowledge • Take samples of all food items before serving the customers • Maintain a positive attitude, smile and greet customers as they approach the serving line • Be polite with customers during the transaction and make sure they are satisfied with their service before helping the next customer • Maintain daily temperature logs • Daily use of correct PPE for the task assigned • Cook and prepare foods according to the recipe • Responsible for using the correct portion controls when preparing and serving food items • Must have product knowledge to effectively service the customer and answer questions about the menu items on the line • Assist co-workers in setting up and breaking down stations as designated by the manager • Sweep and mop the floors • Wash worktables, walls, refrigerators, and cutting boards • Separate and remove waste and place it in the appropriate receptacle • Transfer supplies and equipment between storage and work areas by hand or by cart • Understand the proper use of and storage of chemicals used in the location. Be familiar with the chemical MSDS book and its contents. • Report all injuries immediately to your manager/supervisor  Additional Job Functions: • Cross-train in other areas as required by your manager • Work in other areas or departments as needed • Completion of any task requested by a supervisor or member of the Bridgeman Hospitality management team  Required Qualifications: • Must be able to effectively communicate and understand directions • Must be able to understand safety rules, Bridgeman Hospitality Alcohol Regulations, operating and maintenance instructions and procedures • Must be willing to perform a variety of tasks as assigned • Great customer service and communication skills • Ability to work and succeed in a team environment • Must complete ServSafe Food Handlers certification • Basic mathematical skills are required. Must be able to add, subtract, multiply and divide • Previous customer service experience preferred • Successful completion of the Bridgeman Hospitality Hourly Food Handlers training within the first 30 days of employment • Must be willing to follow all Bridgeman Hospitality Safety Standards  Desired Qualifications: • Experience in the food service industry  Lifting Requirements: MEDIUM: Frequent lifting and / or carrying objects weighing up to 25 pounds. Objects weighing more than 25 pounds require assistance through use of the buddy system.  General Utility Worker: The primary function of the General Utility Worker position is to clean and sanitize all dining utensils, drinking glasses, and dishes to maintain the health and safety standards of the facility and increase overall customer satisfaction.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: • Main duties include cleaning and sanitizing all pots, pans, utensils and all service ware after use • Responsible for proper use of all equipment, specifically cleaning, loading and unloading the dishwasher • Stock, organize, and maintain utensils and all service ware in the food court during meal production • Stock, organize, and maintain utensils, pots, pans, and all service ware in the kitchen during and after meal production • Follow food and service ware safety standards at all times • Clean and sanitize work stations, counters, dish belt, floors, and equipment while following all departmental regulations and procedures • Follow proper sanitation, lifting procedures and food handling controls • Assist in the utility area of the kitchen • Responsible for floor and wall care of entire facility (use Tennant floor machine when applicable) • Spot sweep and clean the floors, checking for spills in the dish room as well as the front of the house • Clean the drains in the kitchen and dish room • Take out trash in the dish room • Cross-train for sanitation, beverages, and table attendant position and provide assistance in those areas as needed • Report safety hazards discovered in the location to management immediately • Report all injuries immediately to your manager/supervisor • Daily use of appropriate PPE for the task assigned • Follow correct use of chemicals used in the location(s)  Additional Job Functions: • Stock inventory shipments and help complete weekly inventory counts • Assist in other areas as needed • Completion of any task requested by a supervisor or member of the Bridgeman Hospitality management team  Required Qualifications: • Able to effectively communicate and understand directions • Able to understand safety rules, Bridgeman Hospitality Alcohol Regulations, operating and maintenance instructions and procedures • Willing to perform a variety of tasks as assigned • Good communication skills and organizational skills • Interest in self development, willingness to learn, and ability to succeed in a team environment • Successful completion of the Bridgeman Hospitality Hourly Food Handlers training within the first 30 days of employment • Must be willing to follow all Bridgeman Hospitality Safety Standards  Desired Qualifications: • Ability to speak and follow detailed written instructions • Courtesy and tact in dealing with guests, co-workers, as well as others in the college community  Listing Requirements: MEDIUM: Frequent lifting and / or carrying objects weighing up to 25 pounds. Objects weighing more than 25 pounds require assistance through use of the buddy system.  Visit us today or apply online athttps://my.peoplematter.com/mja/bridgemanhospitality/JobApp/GetJobOpenings?personId=&city=ann%20arbor&state=mi&StrSelectedLocIds=c063762a-8134-4071-b682-aeb0015ffd51%7C1813ccd0-2499-4118-980f-aeb0015ea1f5&alias=bridgemanhospitality

QR Code Link to This Post   Broken Tart has arrived in Oak Park- and we want you to be a part of our team!        ABOUT US Broken Tart is a **brand spanking new** sister-owned bakery and cafe specializing in cakes, bakes, coffee, and lunch. We are focused on creating an experience at Broken Tart that surprises and delights our customers - both on the everydays AND the milestone days. While that journey begins with our thoughtful (and super delicious!) menu, it comes to life with our commitment to outside-the-box hospitality.   We are building and fostering a respectful and collaborative environment that allows all team members to thrive. We pledge to offer open communication, professionalism, fair wages, and ongoing opportunities for growth and development to each and every member of our team. (We are better together, after all!)  ABOUT THE SAVORY COOK POSITION We are looking for a creative, hardworking, and thoughtful Cook to join our team! Broken Tart is a small but busy bakery and cafe located in Oak Park. As our Cook, we'll look to you to support the development of our rotating lunch offerings.   Responsibilities Include: -Prepping all produce, sauces, dressings, and meats for daily sandwiches and salads -Assembly of all lunch items -Mixing focaccia -Maintaining ingredient stock -Working independently and quickly to complete tasks  Skills and qualities we expect you'll bring to the table: -A knack for health-minded cooking! We aim to provide delicious and healthy lunch options, always offering vegan and gluten-free options as well -Genuine excitement for food and beverage -2+ years of experience in a commercial kitchen environment -High levels of cleanliness and organization -Ability to multitask and think on your feet -Ability to lift 50 pounds -Great communication skills -Creativity (lots of it) -Flexibility (lots of this, too!) -Desire to learn and grow both professionally and personally -A commitment to kindness, curiosity, and leaving things a little bit better than you found it  What you'll get in return: -A dreamy Monday-Friday schedule with daytime hours -Opportunities for menu development -A fun, respectful, and collaborative work environment -Holidays off and pre-scheduled breaks -Daily staff meal and complimentary beverages -Dining discounts -Sick leave in accordance with Cook County law  Other very important details: -Role Type: Full-Time  -Starting Rate: $18/hour based on experience + tips -Schedule: Monday-Friday, Daytime Hours  Sound like a fit? Send us your resume ASAP. We can't wait to hear from you!

Posting Title: Greek's Pizzeria Fishers -  FT or PT  Shift Lead/Mngr $18-20 an hr
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   $18-20 an hr depending on work history. Includes free meals & soda. We are looking for a full or part time shift lead/manager to watch over the restaurant and staff.  In this role you will work both am and pms. So you will have quality time at home when needed and Friday nights off when you need. We are open everyday 11-9pm . Am shift is  9am-3:30/4pm. Pm shift works 3:30/4pm until 9:15pm. We have some flexibility with hours if needed.   Responsibilities include : Be friendly is rule #1. We have a laid back work environment focusing on having fun and creating exceptional pizzas. You will work mainly in kitchen area as oven tender, pizzamaker, or dough pat out's throughout shift while making sure front host staff and drivers are ok. Maintain quality control of pizzas throughout shift. Maintain quoted cook times for customers. At end of shift you will check out the waitstaff of 1-3 and  2-4 drivers that they cleaned and finished appropriate sidework. Lock up at end of night. Close down duties are easy and seamlesss with lists. There are no complex or time consuming duties for you to do. No paperwork to constantly fill out. Simply move about watching staff and make sure pizzas look great and place gets cleaned up at end of night. We make it easy and dummy proof .  Greek's Fishers is a family owned nostalgic pizzeria that is the first in Fishers and 22 years old. We are a neighborhood favorite and embedded in the community.    To apply text Chris : 317 506 3952

Guests know us for transportive spaces and sumptuous fare, but what we are most proud of is the generosity we extend to our teams.  Our service team reimagines hospitality with energy and a sense of fun.  Our culinary team makes classic dishes so expertly that you'll remember why they became classics.  No matter which of our 20+ restaurants you visit, you'll see we're an organization that makes people — our guests and ourselves — happy.   We offer a full suite of benefits and perks, including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401(k), commuter benefits, dining rewards, and Paid Time Off!   Experience and Qualifications:  Our ideal candidate is kind, positive, and works well with others. They also believe in quality, consistency and working in a clean, organized, and inclusive environment where respect and dignity is prioritized.  Must have 1+ years minimum full-service restaurant experience. Must have availability to work evening shifts including weekends and holidays. Must be able to frequently carry up to 20 lbs. Must be positive, collaborative and committed to healthy communication and quality work Will need a valid Food Handler Certification for this role. Ability to remain positive and productive in a potentially hot or cold busy work environment  READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?   Your time is valuable!   Apply directly to this ad, or email jdoren@hogsalt.com directly to set up an interview.    You can also join us at our Open Call held every Tuesday from 12:00-1:00 PM at Trivoli Tavern (114 N. Green Street) for an immediate in-person interview.  We look forward to meeting you!  ________________________________________________________________________________  Gilt Bar está buscando un Cocinero de Preparación de Tiempo Completo ($19-$21/hr) para unirse a su equipo.   Hogsalt no es el típico grupo de restaurante. Los huéspedes nos conocen por los espacios de transporte y la comida suntuosa, pero lo que más nos enorgullece es la generosidad que brindamos a nuestros equipos. Nuestro equipo de servicio reinventa la hospitalidad con energía y sentido de la diversión. Nuestro equipo culinario elabora platos clásicos de manera tan experta que recordará por qué se convirtieron en clásicos. No importa cuál de nuestros más de 20 restaurantes visite, verá que somos una organización que hace felices a las personas, a nuestros huéspedes ya nosotros mismos.   Ofrecemos un conjunto completo de beneficios y ventajas, que incluyen recompensas médicas, dentales, oftalmológicas, de vida, 401(k), recompensas de cenar y Tiempo Libre Pagado!   Experiencia y Calificaciones: Nuestro candidato ideal es amable, positivo y trabaja bien con los demás. También creen en la calidad, la coherencia y el trabajo en un entorno limpio, organizado e inclusivo donde se prioriza el respeto y la dignidad.  Debe tener más de 1 año de experiencia mínima en restaurantes de servicio completo. Debe tener disponibilidad para trabajar en turnos vespertinos, incluidos fines de semana y feriados. Debe poder transportar con frecuencia hasta 20 libras. Debe ser positivo, colaborador y comprometido con una comunicación sana y un trabajo de calidad. Necesitará una certificación de manipulador de alimentos válida para este puesto. Capacidad para mantenerse positivo y productivo en un entorno de trabajo ocupado potencialmente cálido o frío  ¿LISTO PARA UNIRSE A NUESTRO EQUIPO?   ¡Tu tiempo es valioso!   Solicite directamente este anuncio o envíe un correo electrónico a jdoren@hogsalt.com directamente para programar una entrevista.  También puede unirse a nosotros en nuestra convocatoria abierta que se lleva a cabo todos los martes de 12:00 p. m. a 1:00 p. m. en Trivoli Tavern (114 N. Green Street) para una entrevista personal inmediata.  ¡Esperamos contar con su presencia!

Posting Title: In-Home Sales Professionals Wanted! - All Leads Provided
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Are you a highly motivated sales professional wanting to join a team of people that will invest in your career growth?! Here at Window Works, we are looking for individuals like YOU!  At Window Works our people are at the heart of everything we do, and we’ve crafted a team of the very best to ensure we make a difference. Both to the homeowners we support and the staff that’s at the heart of it all.    Position Summary The outside sales department supports the business by quickly forming lasting relationships with our customers. Your job is to help them find a beautiful solution to outdated windows and doors  Essential Duties and Responsibilities •	Receive pre-set appointments from our inside sales department - NO more cold calling •	Facilitate a one-call-close appointment in customer home •	Accurately complete all paperwork before it goes to Sales and Financing •	Collaborating with team members and professionals in weekly team meetings •	Meet with prospective customers using established sales methodology to educate, consult, inform, and sell solutions that will fit their needs within the initial sales consultation •	Develop a rapport and conversation with the customer to facilitate one visit close •	Leverage industry leading product samples, support and technology to assist you in closing the sale •	Commitment to an outstanding customer service experience from beginning to end •	Effectively self-manage sales calendar for prompt arrival at all scheduled appointments •	Understand the need to be available when your customers are available - including evenings •	Must hold a valid driver's license. •	Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.  What’s in it for me? •	Work for the largest home renovation company within the Midwest. We only sell premium products!  •	Paid professional training - $750 per week •	Average earnings of $80k-200k per year (this is what our current reps are making on average, some making more!)  •	We will supply you with an iPad Pro and all demo kit resources •	Sign on bonus & advancement and growth opportunities  Experience and Minimum Qualifications •	2+ years of experience in outside sales, commissioned sales, in-home sales, or a related field •	Excellent communication and organizational skills •	Driven and collaborative approach •	Proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and/or Access). •	Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).  Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications •	Energetic and engaging interpersonal skills with the drive to succeed •	Ability to overcome objections in the sales process  Travel Requirements •	Travel within designated territory.  Overtime/Additional Hours Requirements •	Additional Hours May Be Required (Some Saturday appointments required)   Physical Requirements •	Field Office/Manufacturing/Construction Environment •	Indoor work in a climate-controlled environment. •	Light work. Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects.  To schedule a time to discuss the opportunity in more detail, use the link below to find a time that works for you. I will call you at which the appointment is scheduled.  https://calendly.com/tstoudmire/leaf-home-scheduling  Thank you! Tyson at Window Works

Posting Title: Artisan Food Production - daytime hours M-F, friendly kitchen
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   ****$17 per hour for candidates with a high level of kitchen experience***  Quick Job Highlights! -Seasonal position - through the end of 2022 at least - Full Time or Part Time hours available -Work-life balance - our hours are in the M-F 8-5 time frame. If overtime is available, it's welcome but never expected. - Guaranteed hours - you will not have unexpected changes in your schedule - Happy, collaborative workspace. Our mission in starting our company was to create a great, positive, inclusive and healthy kitchen environment and it is our number one priority. - Opportunity to grow and learn about how a small business works and pursue your interests within the business - different product lines, product development, administrative jobs, etc.   About Us  Quince and Apple is a small-batch maker of artisan food, including preserves, pickles, candied nuts and cocktail syrups. We started this company with the purpose of creating good jobs in food for ourselves and our employees, and we offer predictable weekday hours, flexibility in scheduling, a living wage, paid time off for sick days and vacation days, and a collaborative, friendly work environment. This position will assist the current production team as needed with labeling product, cleaning, shipping, and aspects of production including filling jars and prepping produce. We make preserves, syrups, pickles, and candied nuts, as well as deliver and ship product locally and across the country.  We’re looking for: •	Commercial kitchen experience and interest in food •	A positive and friendly attitude, able to collaborate and communicate with the team •	Someone who enjoys physical work and repetitive tasks •	Physical strength, comfort with hot environments  •	Comfort with heavy lifting up to 50 lbs nice to have but not a requirement •	Strong personal values, including taking health and safety seriously and doing the right thing  Job details: •	Full Time or Part Time •	usual hours within the time frame of Monday-Friday 8-5 •	flexibility in scheduling - if you're a night owl or are in school, we can usually accommodate that! •	$17/hr based on experience; we will train to the position if you have more limited experience •	Our Covid policy changes based on current conditions and incorporates staff input. Currently, our entire team is vaccinated and boosted. We prefer to hire vaccinated candidates who are boosted or willing to get a booster after starting the position. We are not requiring masks at work since case rates have come back down! However, you are welcome to mask if you choose.  If you’re interested, email your resume and a few sentences about why the job interests you. Thanks!

Posting Title: Jet Set Around the Country as a Traveling Property Manager
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Aspen Square Management is now hiring a Traveling Community Manager to join our team!  If you are Focused, Passionate, and a true Go-Getter, this is the position for you!  Aspen Square Management, one of the nation's largest privately held real estate investment & property management firms with a sixty-year track record of success in managing our own assets, is seeking a dynamic professional to join our team working at communities throughout the country.     Aspen is an organization where initiative, collaboration, and creativity thrive. If you are goal-oriented and perform best in an exciting, fast-paced atmosphere, then this position is for you.  Position Details:   As Traveling Community Manager you will travel to properties in our national, diverse portfolio, from Arizona to New England and everywhere in between!  Take charge by leading the repositioning, re-branding, and lease-up efforts at our new acquisitions by implementing your marketing ideas and strategies. You will be responsible for managing daily operations of properties and performing duties including rent collections, managing delinquencies, pushing rent growth, and addressing resident concerns. You will have the opportunity to manage long-term stable assets, in addition to helping with the newly purchases acquisitions. You will manage and implement the marketing plan and techniques used in each specific market, and play a key role in developing the property by being involved in the recruiting and training of new management & leasing professionals.   Position Requirements:    This position requires extensive travel in the U.S. on a 14-day rotation cycle (11 days living at the location assignment with 1 day off, followed by 3 days off at your home base) Live within 1 hour of a major airport hub Minimum 3-5 years management experience including supervising a team (property management, hospitality, retail or restaurant management) Bachelor's degree preferred  Flexible, outgoing, authentic and confident personality  Ability to thrive in an informal, yet fast-paced environment  Entrepreneurial spirit Promoting opportunities in the company and assist in building the team  Compensation:   Competitive salary  Cigna Health Insurance, dental, and vision  401(k) retirement plan with company match Paid holidays/vacation/sick leave Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Employee Rental Discounts   To learn more about our mission, company culture, available positions, and how to continue your career in property management, please visit www.aspensquare.com.  To Apply:  Submit your resume online.  Use our video feature to introduce yourself, and let us know why you'd be a great addition to the team!  https://aspensquare.clearcompany.com/careers/jobs/47ff22ed-679a-45d4-0f90-e03911846dd2/apply?source=2287453-CS-24137

Posting Title: Team Member needed at Wendy's (Brian H Kelemen Associates)!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Click here to apply! Families come in all shapes and sizes. And that includes the Wendy's family - the people you work with as a Wendy's Crew Member. The stuff you want - like fun people, quality food, a schedule to meet your needs, and a paycheck - done. Our founder Dave Thomas had three rules for everyone who works here: Do the right thing. Treat people with respect. Make food better than they'd expect from a fast food place. No doubt you do the first two already. We can teach you the third! Sounds good? Keep reading. Our burgers are square, which means we don't cut corners. So hopefully, neither do you.  Your natural friendliness is just one of your talents. You can handle a lot of stuff and not wig out. You're good with being on drive-thru one shift and making fries the next. You like making customers happy. For real.   What you bring to the table:  Solid social skills - you act like your grandma is standing behind you (at least while you're at work). You see whatever's low - ketchup, straws, cups - and you fill it back up. You pitch in and help your crew and customers. You take and receive direction like a pro. You want to learn something new and be a part of something good. If something doesn't seem right, you make it right.  You must be willing and able to:  Stand and move for most - if not all - of your shift. Lift up to 25-50 lbs. now and then Handle weather related moments like rain at the drive-thru, taking out trash in the summer, etc. Wear a headset, use other restaurant equipment such as a register or grill, and follow brand standards and guidelines. For more information on specific equipment or job requirements, see the job description or talk to the hiring manager.   We get it. We get you. Our food isn't one size fits all and our job opportunities aren't either. Whether you're looking for your first job or to build a career, a lot of hours or something to keep you busy on the weekend, you're an early bird or a night owl, we've got you covered. We are also a proud equal opportunity employer - that means all races, religions, nationalities, genders and the LGBTQ+ community are welcome. We provide reasonable accommodations in order to enable people with disabilities to perform the functions of their jobs. Click here to apply!
