Posting Title: Pedestal Foods is hiring a Starbucks General Manager!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Apply Now!  Job description Pedestal Foods is seeking a General Manager for the Starbucks location on the Lindenwood University campus. In this role, you will report directly to the Director of Dining Services and will lead your team to deliver the high-quality standards expected of the Starbucks brand and our customers.  As the store leader, you are driven by a deep sense of purpose. You are aspirational–never a bystander. You take action to make a positive difference every day, and you inspire others to do the same.  Salary is $55,000.00–$65,000.00 per year.  We offer the following benefits: • 401(k) matching • Dental insurance • Flexible schedule • Health insurance • Paid time off • Vision insurance  You will leverage your retail and management experience to: • Grow a successful business: drive sales leveraging your business acumen, efficiency, and problem-solving skills. • Nurture talent & lead a team: engage the hearts and minds of your team and develop their skills so that they realize their personal best, both as individuals and as thriving teams. • Inspire others: become a dynamic brand ambassador dedicated to driving and achieving results through your team. • Impact your community: integrate your business with the community to create better moments in peoples’ lives, from our partners to our customers, communities, and planet.  We would love to hear from people with: • Starbucks management experience is required. • 6 of years retail/customer service management experience; full-service coffee experience is a plus • Strong organizational, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills • Entrepreneurial mentality with experience in a sales focused environment • Strong leadership skills and the ability to coach and mentor team partners with professional maturity • Must have a high school diploma or GED  Pedestal Foods Mission: As a God-centered company, we purposely integrate into campus culture to help our clients nurture their students through great nutrition, memorable dining experiences, and a spirit of joyful service, every day. College students, staff, and faculty depend on your dining service program to deliver more than just great meals. Our higher education programs provide the choices, flexibility, service, and affordability they expect; our custom menus, brand partnerships, and culinary expertise work to attract new students and serve them through graduation.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Apply Now!

Posting Title: Experienced Line Cook Wanted - Braise Restaurant
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Braise Restaurant is looking for creative, hardworking cooks capable of multi-tasking and willing to learn. This is a perfect position for candidates wanting to prepare and plate inspired, New American cuisine from fresh and local ingredients. Opportunities for Growth and advancement. All the food is hand crafted; we make our own bread, we butcher our own meats and craft our own cocktails.  The food is seasonal, honest and fresh.   The menu is guided by the idea that the proximity of the farm is directly correlated to the quality of its food.  We truly are a farmer and community supported restaurant; as our mission is to reconnect people with their food.  We are passionate about giving our guests more than just a meal, but an experience when they dine with us.  Other available positions include: Prep Cook, Dishwasher & Server

Posting Title: Hogsalt- IL is looking for a Multi-Unit Facilities Repair Technician (
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   DESCRIPTION Hogsalt is seeking a Full Time Multi-Unit Facilities Repair Technician to support our current properties and future development projects.    Hogsalt is not your typical restaurant group.  Guests know us for transportive spaces and sumptuous fare, but what we are most proud of is the generosity we extend to our teams.  Our service team reimagines hospitality with energy and a sense of fun.  Our culinary team makes classic dishes so expertly that you'll remember why they became classics.  No matter which of our 20+ restaurants you visit, you'll see we're an organization that makes people — our guests and ourselves — happy.    We offer a full suite of benefits and perks, including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401(k), Paid Time Off, and dining rewards.    Experience & Qualifications:  Our ideal candidate is kind, positive, and works well with others. They also believe in quality, consistency and working in a clean, organized, and inclusive environment where respect and dignity is prioritized.    Must be available to work a minimum of 28 hours up to 40 hours a week - shifts are Sunday-Thursday. Minimum of 2 years' experience in a multi-unit facilities maintenance position. Excellent operational knowledge of kitchen facilities and equipment. Experience with new builds and renovations. Must be able to provide reliable vehicle. EPA Universal Certification preferred, but not required.   Major Job Duties and Responsibilities:  Ability to perform repairs in the following areas (but not limited to):  Plumbing  Electrical  Kitchen equipment and appliances  Light millwork  Painting  Doors  Tile work   Responsible for overseeing preventative maintenance programs to support the following:   Plumbing  HVAC  Refrigeration  Kitchen hot line equipment  Grease trap cleaning  Kitchen exhaust hood cleaning and mechanicals, and any other areas that can be maintained to prolong the life of the equipment and prevent issues before they arise.  Collaborates with other facilities personnel on various projects.  Responds to maintenance requests from stores in a timely fashion.  Performs regular property inspections.  Advises store managers on a variety of technical engineering issues.  Available on a 24-hour basis in order to address building emergencies during on call shifts.  Reports to Facilities Director, Facilities Manager and other members of the Director team.  Light millwork and construction projects    READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?    Your time is valuable!    Apply directly to this ad, or join us at our Open Calls held every Tuesday from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. at Trivoli Tavern (114 N. Green Street) for an in-person interview.    We look forward to meeting you!   Click Here to Apply

QR Code Link to This Post   APPLY HERE: https://theedgewater.isolvedhire.com/jobs/743845.html  Job Purpose  Servers are dedicated to exceeding expectations of both internal and external guests to ensure the highest level of service is consistently provided. Teamwork is the key to success in providing a warm and personal experience. Servers provide excellent guest service with the assistance of the restaurant's other support staff. Servers ensure the proper set up of the station and work areas assigned and the smooth serving of food and beverage to all of his/her guests. At the end of the night the Server will prepare the set up for the next meal period/next day. Servers will also offer support to all other colleagues in the restaurant, a team of professionals with a passion for food and beverage.   Responsibilities  Specific duties include, but are not limited to the following:  Consistently offer authentic, professional, friendly and warm hospitality to all guests. Foster and practice teamwork and cooperation with all other positions existing in the outlet. Attends all required training sessions and be aware of any changes to menus, hotel and departmental policies and procedures, service standards as well as business trends and requirements. Read and understand all particulars of Event Orders, including start time and beverage requirements. Perform necessary tasks to service guests and is able to handle all guest requests. Assure that opening checklist is completed and that the restaurant is prepared for opening. Observe guests as they enter the restaurant and assure they are greeted promptly and properly using the service standards of "The Edgewater." Wash and sterilize dish and glass ware. Prepare garnishes for drinks and replenish snacks, appetizers for patrons. Maintain cleanliness in all areas including counters, sinks, utensils, shelves and storage areas. Maintains bottles and glasses in an attractive and functional manner to support efficient drink preparation and promotion of beverages. Fill and clean ice bins. Clean and reset tables. Restocking and replenishment of bar inventory and supplies. Promptly removes dishes as guests complete their mean during any meeting or function. Familiar with various types of services- plated, buffet, working lunches, etc. Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment. Expediently communicate any challenges, guest complaints or requests to the Banquet Captain. Must adhere to all State, Federal and Corporate liquor regulations pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages to minors and intoxicated guests to insure all laws are being followed. Perform other related duties that may be assigned by Banquet Captain/supervisor/manager. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.   Qualifications  Previous work experience within an upscale high volume establishment Basic knowledge of fine dining and good knowledge of wines/beverages Strong attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple tasks at once. Ability to communicate effectively with guests, co-workers and management. Strong customer service skills and the ability to resolve customer issues or complaints. Must be able to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and public holidays. Must have excellent working knowledge of liquors, beers and wine. Able to work under pressure. May be required to lift up to 25lbs and the ability to stand for extended periods of time. Neat, well groomed, well-spoken and professional. Demonstrate an understanding of food, food ingredients, food prep methods, proper food storage, sanitation requirements and basic bar terminology.  Conditions  This position operates in a full-service, professional restaurant environment. Hosts are required to use standard restaurant equipment such as point of sale and reservation management computer systems, commercial glassware and plate ware cleaning systems, etc. Their work can require them to move through our kitchen areas. This position requires evening/weekend work.   Physical requirements  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. This position is very active and is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must frequently lift or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Polish all glassware and responsible for sanitation in and around the bar area. Greet guests in a courteous and friendly manner, promotes and documents orders for drinks. Mixes, garnishes and presents drinks using standard ingredient recipes and practicing prudent portion control. Inputs orders into the point of sale and creates a check for each guest and personnel guests, including those served by other beverage servers, to maintain accountability of all beverages served. Expediently communicate any challenges, guest complaints or requests to the Banquet Captain. Check identification of guests ensuring alcohol is being served only to those guests of legal drinking age. After function, remove inventory and all beverage equipment to proper storage. Retrieve and store bar glassware to proper storage. Perform other related duties that may be assigned by Banquet Captain/supervisor/manager. Must adhere to all State, Federal and Corporate liquor regulations pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages to minors and intoxicated guests to insure all laws are being followed. Perform other related duties that may be assigned by Banquet Captain/supervisor/manager. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.   Qualifications  Prior bartending experience, preferably in a high-volume banquet or hotel environment. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple tasks at once. Ability to communicate effectively with guests, co-workers and management. Strong customer service skills and the ability to resolve customer issues or complaints. Must be 21 years old Must be able to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and public holidays. Must be able to perform multiple tasks and prioritize efficiently. Must have excellent working knowledge of liquors, beers and wine. Have ability to obtain any government required license or certificate. Ability to lift, push, pull a minimum of 50lbs. Ability to use moderately complex computer software.  Conditions  This position operates in a full-service, professional restaurant environment. Bartenders are required to use standard restaurant equipment such as point-of-sale computers, cash registers, commercial glassware and plate ware cleaning systems, etc. are required to work in our kitchen areas as well when receiving food orders and returning dishware. This position requires evening/weekend work.   Physical requirements  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. This position is very active and is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must frequently lift or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Posting Title: Bartender at the Marcus Performing Arts Center!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Sazama's Fine Catering, part of Saz's Hospitality Group, is looking for Part Time Bartenders to serve our guests at the Marcus Performing Arts Center. Posting Title: Norwegian Cruise Line- Upcoming Hiring Events!!!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   INTERESTED TO EXPLORE A CAREER AT SEA?This could be your lucky day! We invite you to read more about exciting shipboard opportunities on board M/S Pride of America, sailing year-round in Hawaii!ABOUT PRIDE OF AMERICAInaugurated in 2005, Pride of America is the first US-flagged cruise ship in nearly fifty years.Pride of America was designed to pay homage to the spirit of the United States, with patriotic artwork on the hull and American-themed public spaces.She is currently the only American registered major cruise ship serving the Hawaiian market from Honolulu, sailing to Kahului (Maui), Lahaina (Maui), and Nawiliwili (Kauai).Because she is flagged in the United States, Pride of America is required to carry a US crew. There are 935 crew employed on Pride of America.KEEP SCROLLING FOR MORE EXCITING INFORMATION!NOW HIRING FOR SHIPBOARD POSITIONSNorwegian Cruise Line is currently looking for energetic, hospitality-minded professionals with both recent and relevant experience in one of the following categories:Assistant CookAssistant WaiterBar WaiterEntertainment Technician – Audio/StagehandLaundry PersonnelRestaurant Steward - Busser/ServerPhotographer (1 year of experience required)Seasonal Youth Counselor (2+ years of experience required working with children)Sous ChefStateroom Steward - Hotel Room HousekeepingUtility - Janitorial in Galley & Hotel**Please Note: Some positions may not have active deployment opportunities.IMPORTANT REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL APPLICANTS:You must have a GED or High School DiplomaYou must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and qualify for a U.S. Coast GuardMerchant Mariner Credential (MMC) as well as a Transportation Workers Identification - - Credential (TWIC).In order to qualify for an MMC you must:Be at least 18 years of ageBe a US Citizen or Permanent Resident AlienPass Physical Exam/Drug ScreenHave a Reasonably Clear BackgroundCOMPENSATION & BENEFITS HIGHLIGHTS,Increased entry level salaries with overtime pay!Potential gross minimum salary earnings ranging from $3,000.00 to $3,730.00 monthly, leading to a minimum of $18,000.00 to $22,380.00 gross base salary per assignment (based on a 6-month assignment and 56-hour work week)Gratuity Pay (if eligible)Big Personal Saving Opportunities! (room, food & transportation provided)Hiring Bonus of $1,000 after completion of 1st Shipboard Contract!Paid trainingFriends & Family discounts availableLEARN MORE ABOUT PRIDE OF AMERICA:https://www.ncl.com/cruise-ship/pride-of-americaJOIN OUR VIRTUAL JOB FAIR!We're always looking for new crew! Check out the below link to our Job Fair Calendar to RSVP to an upcoming event!https://jobfaircalendar.splashthat.com/LOGGING ON TO THE VIRTUAL EVENT:· Please check the time difference if you don’t live in the EST zone.· Plan to use earphone/ headset along with a webcam or smart device.· Please sign-in 10 minutes prior to the beginning of the presentation and type your full name.· If using a tablet or smartphone, you will need to download the "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" ApplicationTIME ZONE INFO:If you’re in a different time zone, make sure to know what the time difference will be.WHAT WILL I LEARN?Our Recruiters will tell you all about life and work on board a cruise ship and then they'll begin conducting 1:1 virtual interviews.It is a requirement to watch the entire presentation to be considered for an interview. Allow for 1-2 hours as on screen interviews will immediately follow the 45 minute presentation.If this sounds like a cool opportunity to you, please RSVP using the link above and we’ll look forward to meeting you!Pride of America Recruiting Team

Posting Title: Kitchen Manager - Parson's Chicken & Fish - Logan Sq
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   WHO WE ARE Parson’s Chicken & Fish is a casual restaurant with elevated shack food—where it is summer all the time. We keep a balance of value driven products, striving to be an everyday place rather than a special occasion in price and product. Our goal is to create this style of experience for our guests.  Locations: Logan Sq, 2952 w Armitage Ave  Hours: AM Shift: 9am-6pm PM Shift: 2pm-11pm  Five Shifts Per Week  Covid-19 Vaccination is Required for All Staff  Title: Kitchen Manager  Reports to: GM, Executive Chef, Culinary Director    Position Objective: Example: Our Head Chef is the senior kitchen manager on site, and as such, they are the backbone and leader of the kitchen as a whole. Their primary focus is the oversight of daily operations and the communication with Sous chefs and line staff. This position also oversees food and labor costs. They will maintain the tone and vibe as related from Land and Sea Dept.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Oversight of Staff and Management:  Help maintain employee records for health department, Servsafe certifications Know how to use the order sheet and what vendors all our goods Maintain professional appearance at all time, attitude and appearance  Foster good working relationships with all employees on site including FOH and BOH  Oversight of Sales and Profitability  Maintain food & labor cost inline with budget and forecasting  Oversight of Property  Keep property to cleanliness and maintenance standards Have working knowledge of KDS system Maintain a clean work environment throughout the shift including clean floors, work surfaces, and equipment Observe all city of chicago food safety guidelines May perform other job duties as they arise  Must be able to lift 40 lbs and stand for extended periods of time    Land and Sea Dept. is committed to maintaining our diverse and inclusive workforce and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.     Our company is family friendly and sincerely values a proper work-life balance, offering the accommodations and flexibility our workforce community enjoys and requires.   Paid Time Off:  11 days yearly Paid Time Off   6 Days vacation accrued at ½ day per month  5 Days Earned Sick Leave   Company-wide Discounts:  50% Employee Discount at all Parson's Properties 25% Employee Discount at all LSD Properties Complimentary daily meal at the venue when working on-property Partnership with Chicago Athletic Clubs for discounted membership  FSLA Status: Exempt

QR Code Link to This Post   The Flint Rainbow Club Caretaker Job Description  This position is for Caretaker(s) at a fishing Club in Baldwin, Michigan, located approximately one and a half hours north of Grand Rapids. We are a 38-acre Club with a Caretaker’s home and a lodge used by the members. It is located on the Pere Marquette River, with private frontage for nearly a mile on the “flies only” stretch.  The Club has 27 member families. The lodge has 13 bedrooms and sleeps 26 people. It is primarily used by members and their guests for short term getaways, with most participating in fly fishing, hiking, golfing, and enjoying the great outdoors.  Primary duties are, • Food Service • Housekeeping • General Maintenance • Grounds Keeping • Record keeping, handling reservations, & billing  In addition to the above, basic skills required include light carpentry, yard equipment operation and maintenance, and other skills typically used to maintain a small farm and home. The Caretaker is also responsible for managing contractors on larger projects, such as plumbing and electrical work.  The Club is available for the use of members from the last Saturday in April until October 31 st . During the off season, the Caretakers duties are limited to grounds keeping and general maintenance.  A couple is preferred as a variety of duties, and skill sets required. Candidates should have basic computer skills for bill paying, coordination with contractors and service providers, and general office administration work such as answering phone calls and generally assisting members.  Strong interpersonal skills and conflict resolution skills are a must as interaction with members, guests, contractors, and the general public.  The compensation includes year-around use of the Caretakers home (1,200 square foot, three bedrooms, and 1 bath) including all utilities, and internet, plus a salary, commensurate with experience. The salary is supplemented by revenue from the food service. The Caretakers buy, prepare, and serve the food. The Caretakers are then paid directly for the meals. The Caretakers house includes a commercial kitchen and dining room for members and their guests.  The Caretaker(s) must be self-motivated, have independent reasoning and problem-solving skills and be able to work with limited daily supervision. On-going maintenance on the property may include assistance from the members, but the Caretaker is expected to take the lead when work projects are identified by the Board of Directors.  References will be required, and drug testing may be a condition of employment.  Please send resume and qualifications

And we reward our teams with top notch benefits, career-long training and development and opportunities for growth. If you want a career at a progressive company with a long-standing commitment to people, join our caring and creative team. ​ EOE. Assists with Barista duties as directed. Teamwork, organization and good awareness are necessary for success in this position.   Essential Functions  Clean and reset tables and transport dirty dishes to bus tub, tray or dish room Available to work a variety of hours, days and shifts, including weekends Effectively service a minimum of an eight table section Safely and effectively move chairs, tables, highchairs and booster seats Clean and reset tables and transport dirty dishes to bus-tub, tray or dish room Safely and effectively use and operate all necessary tools and equipment  Ability to effectively communicate in order to perform and follow job requirements in written and spoken direction Ability to multitask calmly and effectively in a busy, stressful environment Work in a confined, crowded space of variable noise and temperature levels Able to move and lift up to 10 pounds, frequently move and/or lift up to 25 pounds, and occasionally move and/or lift up to 50 pounds Ability to stand and walk for an entire shift and move safely through all areas of the restaurant, which may include stairs, uneven or slick surfaces Key Responsibilities and Duties  Ensure the overall guest experience exceeds expectations and anticipate guests’ needs Greet guests with a warm, sincere smile Use tact and good judgement when dealing with guest challenges and respond to guest needs with patience and courtesy  Assist service team with all food and beverage service Follow all steps of service Understand and follow the food allergy procedure and special orders/restrictions Comply with all safety and sanitation guidelines and procedures Follow all rules, policies, procedures and conditions of employment, including those outlined in the Employee Handbook Get along well with others and be a team player Other duties will be assigned as needed   Click Here to Apply

Posting Title: FOOD SAFETY AND QUALITY ASSURANCE DIRECTOR - University of Chicago, IL
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post     At over 300 college & universities around the country, Chartwells Higher Education is re-inventing the on-campus dining experience. We are challenging the norm and setting new standards by investing in high-tech, food-infused social spaces that bring people together to promote meaningful relationships and interactions. We are food-forward difference makers, bound together by a desire to feed hungry minds and prepare students for success.We are seeking hungry, humble and smart associates who are looking to join and grow with a diverse organization. We invite you to start your career journey with us and look forward to hearing from you.  Positions at this location require proof of COVID-19 vaccination, boosters, and/or regular COVID testing. Where permitted by law, applicants who are offered a position for this location may be asked about their vaccination status, which must meet minimum business requirements. All religious, medical, or other legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.Job SummaryWorking as the Food Safety and Quality Assurance Director with Chartwells at the University of Chicago,  you will be directly responsible for the overall food and operational safety of a dynamic food service environment and will be held accountable for tasked with building the overall safety behaviors of the account. The Director operates the department in accordance with the approved safety standards, while maintaining excellent relationships with employees, guests and Client as well as other departments within the operation.   Most important, the Director will be responsible for building a strong culture of Food and Workplace safety and accountability based on team member education, specifically “whys” to exceed the high standard set within Chartwells.We offer free parking, commuter assistance, cell phone reimbursement, long-term growth with a stable market leader, and a full benefits package. Our benefits package includes the best in class health, vision, dental plans along with 401K matching, short and long term disability, life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Programs including wellness and legal support. We also offer paid time off and paid holidays. Key Responsibilities:Lead and provide readiness for Health Division Food Service Inspections, 3rd party Food Safety AuditsPerform unit level safety audits for residential dining, retail, catering and commissary operationsProvide written feedback to unit managers, clients and vendor partners, regarding unit observations and assist with implementation of Compass Safety Standards and Solutions Action PlansLead safety management team meetings and perform Safety/QA Training with associates, and one-on-one with management involvementDevelop, implement and update the Quality Assurance, Food Safety and Emergency PlansProvide verification that the safety systems are working daily, identify deficiencies and implement new strategiesAttend meetings, workshops and special events for safety issuesSupports Food Allergen ComplianceServe as flexible safety specialists as first responders Preferred Qualifications:B.S. degree in food technology, food science, or related curriculum and/or experience required, Masters preferredAt least 10 years of directly related experience required in Quality Assurance and Food SafetyExperienced in prepared foods manufacturing a plusPrior compliance experience with all Health codes, maintain Health permitting and ServSafe Certifications including professional communication skills with all levels of associates and clients; able to train associates and managers; able to analyze problems and select appropriate solutionsAbility to maintain ServSafe Certification (90% or higher) (within 90 days as per Compass Standard)Previous health permitting, QA and Safety Training experience  Attention to detail and ability to help managers to find solutionsDemonstrated written and oral communication skills, and professionalismStrong data management, reporting, and writing skillsStrong understand of FSMA is a mustProficient in MS Office applications including Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and Outlook Positions at this location require proof of COVID-19 vaccination, boosters, and/or regular COVID testing. Where permitted by law, applicants who are offered a position for this location may be asked about their vaccination status, which must meet minimum business requirements. All religious, medical, or other legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.Apply to Chartwells Higher Education today!Chartwells Higher Education is a member of Compass Group USAClick here to Learn More about the Compass Story Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer.  At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *Los Angeles applicants: Compass Group will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box ordinance) Associates at Chartwells Higher Ed are offered many fantastic benefits.MedicalDentalVisionLife Insurance/ ADDisability InsuranceRetirement PlanPaid Time OffHoliday Time Off (varies by site/state)Associate Shopping ProgramHealth and Wellness ProgramsDiscount MarketplaceIdentity Theft ProtectionPet InsuranceCommuter BenefitsEmployee Assistance ProgramFlexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)Req ID: 1126857Chartwells HE CINDY SCHOENFELD [[req_classification]]   To apply for this position, please CLICK HERE

Posting Title: Part Time Host sports bar - Moonlighter
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   The Scofflaw Group is looking for hospitable hosts to join our expanding team at our busy bar The Moonlighter!  A candidate must be outgoing, personable, and be able to multi-task. Part time hours are currently available, weekend availability is a requirement.   Hosts are the first in line of a chain of hospitality and the first as well as the last image a guest will have of the restaurant. They are in charge of greeting and bidding farewell to all guests from the host stand, checking ID's, controlling reservations and seating rotations, placing carry out orders and seating guests.   We are looking for a candidate who is independent, leads by example, and enjoys working with a dynamic staff in a high volume environment.  Compensation: $17/hour + carryout tips averaging 0-$30/shift  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: - Providing a friendly environment and good first impression - Answering phone calls  - Making reservations - Answering guest questions regarding directions, food, drinks, allergies and reservations - Seating guests in a server rotation  Physical Functions: - Ability to stand/walk a minimum of 8 hours or as needed - Must be able to exert well-paced and frequent mobility for periods of up to 8 hours or as needed. - Be able to lift up to 20 pounds frequently. - Will frequently reach, feel, bend, stoop, carry, finely manipulate and key in data. - Work in both warm and cool environments - High levels of noise from music, customer and employee traffic.  Scofflaw Group values inclusivity, warm guest interactions, and delivering the highest quality product.  **Please respond with your availability along with your resume!

Posting Title: Experienced Line Cook Wanted - Braise Restaurant
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Braise Restaurant is looking for creative, hardworking cooks capable of multi-tasking and willing to learn. This is a perfect position for candidates wanting to prepare and plate inspired, New American cuisine from fresh and local ingredients. Opportunities for Growth and advancement.  Minimum 1 year line cook experience required.  Culinary education and knowledge of local food a plus! 4-5 shifts a week, 3pm-close.  Email qualifications and/ resume through Craigslist ad. Culinary Students encouraged to apply. Full Time position available. Lead Line cook position available for right candidate.  $15/hr starting wage w/ opportunity for salaried position.  Braise is a time honored cooking method rooted in technique. This purity in cooking is showcased in our reverence for local ingredients.  All the food is hand crafted; we make our own bread, we butcher our own meats and craft our own cocktails.  The food is seasonal, honest and fresh.   The menu is guided by the idea that the proximity of the farm is directly correlated to the quality of its food.  We truly are a farmer and community supported restaurant; as our mission is to reconnect people with their food.  We are passionate about giving our guests more than just a meal, but an experience when they dine with us.  Other available positions include: Prep Cook, Dishwasher & Server

Actively committed to fostering ways to enjoy great-tasting, healthy food through socially responsible practices and superior customer service, the Atlanta-based company serves more than 450 senior living clients in 42 states, including some of the largest and most prominent senior living communities in the United States.    This position is eligible for an Employee Referral Bonus! We offer a full suite of benefits and perks, including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401(k), dining rewards, and Paid Time Off!   Responsibilities/Job Duties:  Manage outside consultants to ensure project timelines and goals are met Manage and verify contractor requests for payments Assist coordination of kitchen design and installations Liaison between ownership, GC and subcontractors to ensure standards are upheld Review contractor bids for accuracy and negotiate areas where needed for fair pricing Manage construction schedule from mobilization to completion Ensure project construction is executed correctly to plan. Ensure project construction stays on schedule, and communicate when issues and changes will impact the schedule. Manage relationships with general contractors and onsite contractors on a day-to-day basis. Ensure job sites are maintained in a clean, organized, and safe fashion. Obtain necessary project paperwork, including but not limited to quotes, invoices, lien waivers, COIs, and change order requests. Ensure most up-to-date plans and information is on-site. Work with Construction Director to create an initial project budget and schedule. Meet with contractors to review the scope and gather quotes and proposals. Obtain change order requests for approval. Relay design and build changes appropriately to the construction team as they occur   Qualifications  Strong interpersonal skills Flexible and willingness to adapt to ongoing changes Excellent communication skills Project Management experience Ability to take initiative and come up with creative solutions Highly organized 3-5 years of experience in commercial construction. Knowledge of practices and procedures of construction and building codes. Ability to read and interpret blue prints. Attention to detail Valid driver’s license with good driving record. Valid auto insurance coverage.   READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?    Your time is valuable!    Apply directly to this ad, or join us at our Open Calls held every Tuesday from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. at Trivoli Tavern (114 N. Green Street) for an in-person interview.    We look forward to meeting you!  Click Here to Apply

Posting Title: Late Night Slice - Piesan (Pizza Maker) - High and Vine
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Columbus' Original Street Pizza, Late Night Slice is casting for Piesans! Through our quirky personality, urban style and our crazy, progressive ideas like, every human should be treated equal, we've quickly risen to be one of Central Ohio's most recognized break-out brands. Our Culture is the most important thing to us at LNS and we choose team members very carefully. Hey, we don't want to work next to jerks either.     Like everything at LNS, our benefits are our own and they go far beyond what's expected. Piesans will also be directly responsible for making menu items, and maintaining a clean work space in compliance with Late Night Slice training curriculums.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Responsible for making and prepping any food items while on their shift, in compliance to any guidelines or instructions given by their direct person in charge.Responsible for maintaining shop cleanliness in accordance to the Open, Close, During sheetsResponsible for using checklists to ensure store cleanliness before, during, and after shiftsMust maintain a positive attitude and demeanor when interacting with guests, peers, and supervisorsMust treat each guests with fairness and respect during all transactionsPerforms all other duties as assignedPlease apply online with LNS MANAGEMENT COMPANY, LLC at: https://lns-management-company-llc.prismhr-hire.com/job/169549/late-night-slice-piesan-pizza-maker-high-and-vine-columbus?s=cl

El candidato ideal es responsable, puntual, ordenado, con excelente actitud, que disfrute trabajar con gente y en un equipo diverso, que tenga pasión por la hospitalidad y el servicio al cliente. El candidato ideal es responsable de hacer y servir bebidas de té, café y de otras bases, además prepará comida y algunos ingredientes de nuestro único menu siguiendo las recetas exactamente como son.     Requisitos: - Mínimo un año de experience en la industria de la hospitalidad o servicio al cliente.  - Experiencia en cafe y comida es de ayuda mas no necesaria.   - Hablar español - Personal ideal debe ser organizada, poder realizar varias tareas al mismo tiempo, atenta a los detalles, servicial, con buena actitud y ganas de trabajar.  - Que pueda levantar hasta 30 libras y frecuentemente agacharse y girar su cintura.  - Que esté disponible para trabajar los fines de semana, abrir el café (6:30am) y/o cerrarlo (4:00 pm), trabajar en eventos especiales, algunos días festivos.   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   PT Barista/Server – No night shifts, great pay   Tired of working late night shifts, and on major Holidays? Responsible and reliable.   Qualifications: - 2 to 3 years of retail/hospitality experience required.  - Coffee and food and beverage experience is required.  - Spanish speaking a must. - Food Handler Certification required - Well organized, detail-oriented and able to multi-task. - Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs and frequently bend and twist from the waist.  - Be able to work weekends, special events, early morning shifts and overtime. Potential candidates expect an in-person interview and may ask to prepare a drink.

Posting Title: Front of House Manager | Oxford Hotels and Resorts | Now Hiring
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Culinary Agents is working with the team at Oxford Hotels and Resorts to connect them with talented hospitality professionals.  Oxford Hotels and Resorts - Now Hiring: Front of House Manager Click here to learn more & apply today!  Oxford Hotels & Resorts is an award-winning full service hotel and food & beverage management company with a long established track record in the ownership and management of large-scale hotels, resorts, conference centers, restaurants, bars and rooftops throughout the United States. This portfolio includes a growing collection of independent lifestyle hospitality brands such as The Godfrey Hotel, LondonHouse, Hotel Julian, Le Meridien Essex, and The Thompson Chicago.   Purpose and Performance Goals All employees are expected to deliver truly great service, and to create a warm and friendly atmosphere for our guests. Employees must work well as a team, maintain confidentiality and adhere to company policies. Essential Duties and Responsibilities   Interact with guests and investigate problems and find solutions Assist staff on the floor and help drive revenue at each table Communicate with guests via phone and take detailed notes Resolve complaints and order issues Inventory and order dry goods and supplies. Ensure storage zones are organized and cleaned regularly Inform general manager each night on overall customer satisfaction Isolate and identify areas of improvement in service, cost controls, organization, and safety Develop and implement a minimum of one idea per month to either drive revenue, reduce expenses, or both, working with the general manager Delegate tasks to be completed by each employee, not limited to their beginning or end of shift duties Monitor the team’s performance Assist the team by performing the tasks with them Train and develop staff Handle complaints (from both staff and customers) Report to upper management when required Complete end of night audit and sending detailed email to all Supervisors, Managers and Chefs Ensure all side work is completed by each employee Create and execute floor plan for all staff Ensure proper floor plan is back to correct placement after all events Orchestrate a full staff and communicate with them directly Work with Micros/Simphony and Tock/OpenTable (depending on location) Use Microsoft Office proficiently Be able to open, close, work weekends, and holidays Perform other duties as assigned  Other Skills and Abilities Required:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills Customer service-oriented mentality with a consistently outgoing, upbeat and positive personality Leadership qualities and professional, well-groomed appearance Ability to work in a team and independently Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and meet multiple deadlines Ability to successfully work in a fast-paced environment Ability to maintain composure in stressful environments Ability to successfully interact with all levels of employees and management Ability to attend all required company meetings  Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand (a minimum of 8 hours), walk, and use hands to touch, handle, or feel, grasp, and hold objects, tools, or controls. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms, balance (service trays, glasses included), stoop, crouch, bend, talk, hear, taste, and smell. The employee may be required to frequently climb stairs. The employee is occasionally required to kneel. The employee must occasionally lift, carry, pull and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus in low-lighting conditions. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud and potentially stressful.   Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.   Education and/or Experience  Ability to communicate information and hotel services to management and guests. High School Diploma Proficient in Microsoft applications Experience with Simphony or Micros 3700 POS is preferred Experience with Tock Reservation Platform, OpenTable, or similar is preferred Experience of three to five years in a hotel restaurant, bar, or nightlife venue preferred  Language Skills Ability to read, write and speak fluently, in the primary language of the property location Mathematical Skills Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in units of measure, using whole numbers. Reasoning Ability Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations Bassett, ServSafe and ServSafe Allergens Training Certified Hours Due to the seasonal nature of the hospitality industry, and the fact that the hotel provides guest services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and employee may be required to work rotating shifts, night shifts, and/or overtime. Work Environment  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud and potentially stressful.     Create your FREE profile on CulinaryAgents.com to apply to any job with a single click! Posting Title: Food Runner at Michelin-Starred Fine Dining Restaurant
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   CLAUDIA is a fine-dining restaurant from Chef Trevor Teich, a Chicago native who has worked in some of the country’s best restaurants, including L20, NOMI, Acadia, and Twist by Pierre Gagnaire in Las Vegas.  After many years as a pop-up he now brings his culinary vision to a historic location in Chicago’s Bucktown neighborhood.  CLAUDIA features an elegant dining room, Chef's Table experience, and a full bar offering a multi-course tasting menu of playful, innovative, and evocative dishes.  Required Years of Experience: 1 year  Job Details: We are looking for a passionate and experienced Food Runner to join our dining room team. The ideal candidate has a commitment to excellence and a desire to learn and grow.   CLAUDIA food runners curate sensational experiences for every guest that dines with us. They maintain control of the flow of service and ensure that all food is reaching the guest in time and presented at the highest level. They efficiently communicate with—Captains and Assistant Servers, and partner with Sommeliers to execute beverage service tailored to each guest.  Health benefits  Competitive hourly rate  https://culinaryagents.com/jobs/412241-Food-Runner https://www.claudiarestaurant.com/

Posting Title: Cook - Mari de Villa Senior Living
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   We currently have an opening to be a cook in our dietary department.  We are looking for someone who is looking to create and serve high quality meals for the seniors who reside and staff at Mari de Villa. If you're interested in becoming part of the Mari de Villa, reach out today!   Job description  *Full Time position * 10:00am to 6:30pm  Excellent Benefits: Full Health Insurance, Full Dental Insurance, Sick Pay, Holiday Pay, Vacation Pay, and addition Benefits to be discussed at time of interview. (Mari de Villa covers 100% of the health and dental premiums)  Scheduled for every other weekend  Your day-to-day:      Prepare high quality food items for customers in a timely and consistent manner.     Set up station as designed     Practice sanitation and safety daily to ensure the kitchen remains clean during and following your shift     Conform with quality standards     Prompt and reliable adherence to attendance policies and company policies     Work varying schedules to reflect the business needs.     Work cooperatively and collaboratively with other departments as needed.  Specific experience we're seeking:      Clear communication skills.     Basic computational abilities.     Ability to read recipes and follow instructions.     Ability to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Prior experience required. Depending on the role degree may be required. LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read, write, and verbally communicate effectively and professionally with other business departments, guests, and vendors. Ability to diplomatically deal with difficult situations and people, while exhibiting a consistent level of professionalism. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, or telephone. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10-25 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: From $17.00 per hour  Benefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance  Paid sick time Paid time off Year End Bonus  Shift:     8 hour shift

Posting Title: Line Cook Position available at Morel in MKE
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Morel Restaurant is a modern American restaurant that's dedicated to source consciousness, Morel's menu finds inspiration from Wisconsin exploring natural flavors, colors, and textures from local farms, purveyors, foragers, and artisans. We are currently seeking to hire a Line Cook to join our team of culinary professionals.  This is a great opportunity for individuals looking to learn new skills such as butchering whole hogs, lamb, fish, etc. making charcuterie, sausages, terrines and smoking meats. We are open Tuesday - Saturday.   Line Cook Duties/Responsibilities: • Stocking and setting up various stations with needed items. • Preparing dishes per recipe, to restaurant standards. • Complete orders in an accurate and timely manner. • Dicing, chopping, cutting, etc. various ingredients for service. • Taking direction from senior cooks and/or chefs. • Cleaning cooking utensils and station and organizing equipment/food at the end of shifts and throughout  Line Cook Requirements Skills/Abilities: • Eager to learn • Understanding of various ingredients, cooking methods,and procedures. • Positive attitude • Night and weekend availability • One year experience as a Line Cook, or Prep Cook. • Knife skills  Please include a resume, and your contact info in your response or apply on our website at www.morelmke.com

Posting Title: Coffee Shop Manager for Historic Wacker/loop location
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   We are looking for a Downtown Cafe Manager to organize daily operations and motivate our staff to become a highly sought after coffee shop.   Our desire is to find a manager with extensive experience within the café industry who will be responsible for daily operations of our coffee shop. The café manager's principal responsibilities will include supervising staff; performing maintenance and repairs on equipment; processing payments; banking; and maintaining a clean, presentable and friendly environment within the café.  The ideal candidate will have both management and leadership skills and will be able to ensure that all duties within the café are executed with customer service in mind.   Café Manager Responsibilities Include: Recruit, hire, train, and supervise café staff; Oversee scheduling of staff members and be able to quickly find replacements in the event of a staff member absence; Budget management to ensure profitability with the goal of maximizing operational costs; Inventory; and Customer service. Café Manager Job Requirements: Managerial experience (management skills with exemplary organizational, time management, communication, and customer service skills); Experience working in the food or hospitality industry; and   Food handler’s license required by the State of Illinois.  The goal of the café manager is to take this historic and prime city cafe location and make it a destination spot for tourists as well as the local business community. We will have our own gifted coffee roaster providing a highly sought after bean both retail and offered for wholesale.  The right manager will be passionate about coffee and will look to create a unique atmosphere encouraging the establishment of a loyal customer base by crafting a local hotspot for the community's enjoyment.   Please reply, with resume, for further consideration and potential interview.   Thanks, Joe Bullock

Posting Title: WANTED Bartenders & Servers - Pedro's Mexican Restaurant

Take accurate food and drink orders using a POS system and communicate order details to the kitchen staff as needed. Check customer’s ID if necessary to assure they are of legal drinking age. Inform guests about restaurant customer loyalty program, or any other specials and promotions. Serve food and make drinks mostly Margaritas to guests. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is what keeps guests coming back. You remain cool, calm and collected under pressure. You understand there is no “I” in team and thrive in social situations. You get that service isn’t a transaction - It’s about connection. That a smile can make all the difference in someone’s day. It’s genuine, and it’s who you are.

QR Code Link to This Post   https://careers.flemingssteakhouse.com/server-assistant/job/20772439  Job Description At Fleming’s, We Live, Breathe & Dream Steak & Wine!      Fleming's is rooted in our principles and beliefs. We foster a passionate team culture where everyone is supported, encouraged, engaged and celebrated.  Our first in class training programs enable our restaurants to have a positive environment to learn, grow and advance.  Text "Prime" to 30437 to apply now!    At Fleming’s, your first and most important responsibility will be creating memorable moments for our Guests. As a Backwaiter, you will be responsible for assisting the kitchen and assisting our Servers in the dining room. Working in the kitchen, you will help with assembly of prepared food and condiments following Fleming’s standards. You will need to check orders for accuracy and review those orders with the Guests to ensure they are prepared to our Guest’s expectations. Working alongside the servers you will be expected to help track food times, stock tables with proper items needed, bussing tables, offering drink recommendations and refills, decanting and selling wine & performing table side service to create an elevated and seamless experience for our Guests.   Perks & Benefits that we offer at Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar:   Career Growth. We believe in developing people!  Work/Life balance. Flexible scheduling and PTO (when eligible) to take that much needed "me" time!  Health & Wellness benefits. We offer health (medical, dental and vision) insurance options for eligible team members  Meal comp benefits  Anniversary Program  Rx for pet’s prescription savings program  Employee discounts with Perks at Work  Rewards and recognition programs because we appreciate all that you do  Bloomin’ Brands, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V are encouraged to apply.

Posting Title: Back of House  Prep Cook, Line Cook, Dishwashers
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Kitchen + Kocktails, Chicago, offering a great modern spin to Southern Comfort Food and a great selection of craft beer, wine, some of the best Kraft Kocktails around.  Now Hiring – "Back of the House" position(s)  *Line Cooks  *Prep Cooks  *Dishwashers  Summary of Position:  The Line Cook is capable of executing various stations such as flat top, fryer, waffle, char grill, and sauté. Our cuisine ranges from Chicken & Waffles, Shrimp & Grits, Lamb Chops, Gumbo, Fried Catfish and MORE!  Prep Team:  Our Prep Team starts at 5am every morning and follow strict recipe cards, par lists and prep lists to make sure our Kitchen is set up for success for service.  Line Cook: We have an AM & PM shift for our Line Cooks. Am starts at 8am and PM starts at 3pm. Each line cook has a station and menu items that come off each station they're assigned to. Stocking your shift, cleaning as you go, and effective communication is key to success of your shift!  Dishwashers: Dishwashers are the heart of our kitchen and assisting with maintaining the cleanliness of it; maintaining our dish pit, refilling the soap and paper towels in the kitchen, maintaining our garbage and the overall kitchen space.  We are aggressively hiring and looking to double our staff!   Qualifications:  • Good communication skills  • Previous experience with grilling, salad and sandwich preparation, pans and deep frying  • Able to accurately read and communicate orders  • Well organized, shows a sense of urgency; able to track multiple orders and multi task  • Works well under pressure  • Team player, works productively with others  • Understanding of food safe practices  Key Responsibilities:  • Presents him/herself professionally, e.g. clean uniform, well groomed  • Maintains up to date knowledge of recipes, procedures and plating for all menu, special and promo items for which he/she is responsible  • Prepares grill/char grill/salad/sandwich/entree items to recipe or special order  • Meets timing standards  • Coordinates orders with others, assists coworkers as needed  • Works cooperatively with front of house staff to respond to guest needs  • Ensures his/her areas of responsibility are well stocked and guest ready  • Maintains high standards of cleanliness, safety and food safety throughout the shift  • As required: stock taking, cleaning, opening and closing tasks; and any other duties designated by the management team or Kitchen Leader.  Physical Demands:  • Must be able to stand and exert well-paced mobility for up to 8 (+) hours in length.  • Ability to lift and carry 0-75 pounds on a regular basis, throughout the shift.  • Must be able to push and pull equipment of various sizes and weights (e.g. 25lbs pot of hot water), throughout the shift.  • Must be able to kneel, bend, stoop, squat and stretch to fulfill tasks.  • Requires grasping, standing, walking, repetitive motions, hearing ability and visual acuity.  We offer:  -great working environment  -flexible schedule  -paid training  -room to grow with the company  -most of all, a fun and exciting place to work!

QR Code Link to This Post   You know how a restaurant stays in business for more than 46 years? By finding amazing hospitalitarians like you to provide The Finest in food, service and experience to its guests and team every single day. We're a 5-time Top Workplaces Award recipient, and we want to show you why!    As General Manager, the right candidate will have a variety of responsibilities to helm the State House ship. This full-time role will operate from Saz's State House on 55th and State St. No two days will be the same, but the list below gives an overview of General Manager's primary focus, along with providing unexpectedly, over-the-top amazing service every day.   Act in sync with corporate leadership and take an ownership approach to decisions that affect business, service, culture, guest relations and food quality.  Make all decisions with SHG brand standards and mission, vision and core values in mind.  Engage in local market and community to gauge and improve brand awareness, drive sales growth and meet market demand.  Provide leadership and guidance to FOH and BOH teams and leaders; promote a “service first”’ environment.  Ensure consistent delivery of products and service consistent with SHG standards of procedure, quality, policy and within budget; proactively address improvement opportunities.  Work closely with all management staff and ownership; ensure open lines of communication between FOH and BOH teams.  Address quality and presentation of food and beverage at all times.  Plan and execute strategies that facilitate the growth and improvement of Saz’s State House and the SHG brand.  Additional, functional tasks of the General Manager will support and execute these goals, and the evolving priorities of the organization, team and restaurant.    Competitive salary of no less than $68,000/year will be based on experience, and bonuses up to $10k/year are available for reaching established monthly targets. Saz’s Hospitality Group is thrilled to offer a variety of benefits to full-time employees, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, paid time off, and a variety of discounts and partner programs. All team members are eligible to enroll in HealthiestYou 24/7/365 telemedicine plan with monthly premiums paid 100% by SHG and free work shoes from our partners at Shoes for Crews!      This role is also eligible for a $5000 hiring bonus paid in segments throughout the first year on the team! It is our policy to seek and employ the best qualified personnel in all positions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, disability, national origin or any other basis made unlawful by either state or federal law. QR Code Link to This Post   Company Brewing is looking for an Executive Sous Chef to manage the daily opeations of our kitchen. Please email your resume and cover letter (a personal message in the body of the email works as a cover letter) to careers@companybrewing.com. We look forward to meeting you!  ---------------------------------------------------------  COMPANY BREWING JOB DESCRIPTION   JOB TITLE: Executive Sous Chef / Kitchen Manager REPORTS TO: Owners RATE OF PAY: Salary/Hourly - competitive, based on experience - $55k/yr and up BENEFITS: Paid Time Off, Employee Discounts. EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS: Passion for craft beer, delicious food, and live music is required.  High School education or equivalent. 4 years experience as a Line Cook level or higher. Up-to-date ServSafe Certification  POSITION SUMMARY: The Executive Sous Chef is part of the management team that includes the Owners, Head Brewer, and FOH Lead. The Executive Sous Chef is primarily responsible for ensuring the best overall dining experience for our guests. This is a full time position - 40 hours per week is expected, and presence during peak times is required.   SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES  GENERAL / BUSINESS PERFORMANCE Attend and contribute to regular manager meetings. Maintain open communication with other departments (FOH, Brewery, Marketing/Admin) Have a thorough understanding of POS system and make changes/add items as necessary Follow recipes, monitor portion sizes and control waste to meet profit goals.   FOOD QUALITY Maintain the highest level of food quality and attend to food quality issues as they arise.  Maintain quality standards and techniques for achieving them, and ensure kitchen staff performance.  Generate enthusiasm for food among staff, and actively promote the food/restaurant to customers.  Regularly meet with owners to review menu offerings, food quality expectations, kitchen management procedures.  STAFF MANAGEMENT Execute a successful staff training program. Assure that opening, shift change and closing checklists are completed.  Recommend disciplinary actions and write-ups to Owners. Maintain a culture of respect and personal accountability and hold staff to that standard.   SHIFT MANAGEMENT Manage BOH staff during service to achieve speed and product quality goals. Be prepared and able to back up all positions during peak times.  Analyze labor needs as shift progresses and promptly adjust staff accordingly to achieve labor cost goals. Be a resource for all staff when other managers are not present.  KITCHEN MANAGEMENT Maintain a secure, clean, organized, safe, sanitary, and prepared kitchen. Monitor daily/weekly/monthly cleaning schedules. Check all deliveries and invoices for accuracy and deliver paperwork to the accounting department. Regularly monitor and order BOH ingredients/inventory and supplies  CONTINUING EDUCATION Show an ability to learn and expand skill-set. Take direction from owners, communicate clearly, and seek new knowledge and information Desire to continue to improve management skills and train and improve staff

Posting Title: DIRECTOR DINING SERVICES - Anderson University - Anderson, IN
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post     At over 300 college & universities around the country, Chartwells Higher Education is re-inventing the on-campus dining experience. We invite you to start your career journey with us and look forward to hearing from you. Job SummaryFeed Hungry Minds with Chartwells at Anderson University in Indiana!The Director of Dining Services is an exciting opportunity for an energetic, entrepreneurial manager who is constantly seeking a better way to conduct business. This key leadership position is directly responsible for the successful operation of residential dining and catering services. The Director ensures client, customer service/satisfaction with efficient cost effective management that both meets and exceeds stated expectations.We offer free parking, commuter assistance, cell phone reimbursement, long-term growth with a stable market leader, and a full benefits package. Our benefits package includes the best in class health, vision, dental plans along with 401K matching, short and long term disability, life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Programs including wellness and legal support. We also offer paid time off and paid holidays.Key Responsibilities:Manages salaried managers and hourly associates in the food service departmentOversees the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of the accountInterviews, hires, and trains associates; plans, assigns, and directs work; appraises performance; rewards and disciplines associates; addresses complaints and resolves problemsPrepares and manages annual budgetUtilize company systems for completion of required daily/weekly/monthly reports such as inventory, cash reports, production records, payroll/time-keeping, etc.Oversees and participates in the preparation and service of food and beverage items in adherence to company food standards for preparation, presentation, sanitation and safety (meeting HACCP and OSHA guidelines) and portion controlOther duties as assigned Preferred Qualifications:B.S. Degree in Food Services Technology/Management or related field; or A.A. Posting Title: PRODUCTION SOUS CHEF for The Shinola Hotel
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   James Beard Award-Winning Chef Andrew Carmellini and the New York City-based NoHo Hospitality Group team is in Detroit!  The Shinola Hotel is seeking an PRODUCTION SOUS CHEF   Featuring Detroit-inspired design with multiple food and beverage venues from NoHo Hospitality Group, The Shinola Hotel will reflect the best of Shinola's American-built craftsmanship to provide an experience worthy of the city itself.  Ideal candidates possess: *1-2 years of experience as a Production Sous Chef preferably in a 4-5 star hotel environment or off-site catering operation. *Advanced knowledge of house equipment, setup and presentation standards. *Developed knowledge of various food service styles including stations, family-style, buffet and plated services. *Excellent written and verbal communication skills with fluency in English, multilingualism will be considered an asset. *Strong leadership skills, developed organizational and multi-tasking abilities and sound administrative skills. *Always uphold Department of Health (DOH) regulations and standards. *Excellent leadership skills and outstanding listening skills. *Assist with ascertaining departmental training needs and develop and support implementation of such training. *Compute basic arithmetic.  Benefits: We offer medical, dental, and vision benefits day of hire for full-time employees, 401(k), Paid Time Off, as well as other incredible discounts!  Since first partnering in 2009, chef Andrew Carmellini, Josh Pickard and Luke Ostrom have opened a national portfolio of restaurants and culinary services at preeminent hotels, live music venues and major metropolitan sports arenas and airports across New York City, Baltimore, Detroit and Nashville including Locanda Verde, The Dutch, Joe’s Pub and The Library at The Public, Lafayette, Bar Primi, Leuca, Westlight, Mister Dips, Rec Pier Chop House, The Cannon Room, San Morello, Evening Bar, The Brakeman, Penny Red's, Carne Mare, The Dutch Nashville and Carne Mare Nashville. The team actively runs food and beverage operations in four hotels, including The Greenwich Hotel, The William Vale, Sagamore Pendry Baltimore and the Shinola Hotel. Known for delivering quality experiences and pertinent culinary culture, each place is a distinctly owned, handcrafted labor of love. They've received widespread critical acclaim, recognition on countless “Best of” lists, a Michelin star, and two coveted James Beard Foundation awards. To learn more, visit nhgnyc.com or AndrewCarmellini.com.

Venga a trabajar en el centro de Sun Prairie, a solo veinte minutos del centro de Madison, en una cocina nueva, limpia y bien administrada con un gran equipo.  • Salario competitivo a partir de $18 por hora • La bebida y la comida del turno se incluyeron en cada turno trabajado • Descuento para empleados cuando no están trabajando • Cerrado todos los días festivos importantes  ¡Responde a este anuncio, envía un currículum o entra para hablar!

QR Code Link to This Post   Toast is looking to add a Lead Host / Host to our weekend Team! This would be a part-time job for Saturday / Sunday only. Shifts run from 8 am – 4 pm. Pay averages from $18.00 - $20.00 an hour.   We provide exceptional service in a casual, hip, and fun ’60s / ‘70s stylized brunch joint. We are looking for a high-energy Host who is a team player and isn’t afraid of stairs. While experience is a plus, a happy, upbeat & positive vibes personality goes a long way. We work hard but at the same time don’t take ourselves too seriously!  Our host team interacts with our phone system, Yelp Waitlist, Toast POS, and uses headsets for communication during shifts. There are three roles – Greeter, Seater & Plotter. We work as a team to seat efficiently and manage a wait that is generally 30-50 parties or 30 mins to an hour plus wait. Our Servers are trained to pre-bus 😉, and we generally turn and burn tables within 45 seconds to a min.  Pay: DOE $8.00 - $12.00 an hour + Tip Pool  The Tip pool is generated from Server’s tip out. Severs tip out 3.5% of their Net Sales. The tip pool is divided between the Bar and Host team with 60% going towards the Bar and 40% towards the Host. This is further divided up based on hours worked. This is done daily versus weekly. The tip pool can be collected after the shift if you wait for management to complete it or the following day.  Benefits:  Health, Dental, Life, and Vision Insurance are offered after 90 days. Each consecutive year with the company (at any of our locations), we cover an additional 10% of insurance costs. (FT requirement of averaging 32 hours a week)  SIMPLE 401(k) plan with a 3% match. (FT requirement of averaging 32 hours a week)  We value continued education: Get ServSafe Manager Certified and automatically receive a $1.00 raise for all positions worked.   During Training, you receive free meals  50% employee discount  We often have cash bonuses for sales goals, sales competitions, etc.

QR Code Link to This Post   DESCRIPTION: Snook’s Butcher Shoppe, d.b.a Colasanti’s Produce and Plants is a family owned, gourmet grocery store and greenhouse located in Highland, Michigan.  Please DO NOT confuse this with Highland Park.  We are adjacent to the town of Milford.  Our store mission is Fresh Food and Friendly People.  We pride ourselves on not being a chain store and provide quality food with great customer service to our customers.  Many of our customers frequent our store several times a week and are just like family. SUMMARY OF JOB: The Deli Manager provides leadership in Deli Department by directing and managing all associates activities, including their in store training, orders all products and supplies for the deli, schedules associates, determines production amounts, and implements merchandising initiatives to grow the business while meeting customer requirements and maximizing profits. Must be a skilled decorator. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:  Supervises all associates in the Deli Department. Specific number depends upon the time of year.  KNOWLEDGE SKILLS:  Technical skills needed in the Deli industry, including purchasing and pricing of Deli products. Good leadership skills with friendly, outgoing attitude. Strong verbal skills for dealing with customers and associates. Ability to read and understand profit and loss statements and to interpret various reports. Some knowledge of computers.  Must be safeserv certified.  WORKING CONDITIONS : Works behind the Deli counter and works directly with the kitchen staff. Will stand for long periods of time. Constant interaction with customers and associates daily.   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  • Lifting and carrying over 50lbs.• Operating equipment (power jack, bakery slicer, ovens, scales, stove). • Bending, reaching and grasping. • Standing for extended periods and walking. • Some tolerance for stress. • Hearing (Auditory)   BENEFIT PACKAGE INCLUDES:  • Medical Insurance Plan •  Prescription Drug Coverage •  Paid Sick Time * Closed 4 Holidays a year • Vacation Time after 1 year of service * Life Insurance, Dental, Vision, and LTD paid for by the store * Matching 401K plan  RESPONSIBILITIES:  • Manages department inventories by tracking weekly sales reports and orders products and supplies so as to meet customer requirements, improve department sales and the company’s gross profit goals.  • Schedules all deli associates following allowable hour guidelines as set the Owner, oversees and participates in ongoing training efforts in which department associates are taught specialized skills developed over years, rewards and recognizes associate performance and delegates work assignments so as to most effectively utilize the talents and abilities of associates while maximizing department productivity and profits.  • Develops and implements merchandising plans or follows guidelines or suggestions for merchandising plans provided by others that meet the financial objectives of the department. Keeps abreast of all weekly advertised and in store specials to insure correct pricing and proper production amounts.  • Inspects and checks product and supplies upon delivery. Enforces and follows department practices regarding receiving, dating and restocking to ensure product rotation. Monitors product quality and freshness. Ensures that out-of-code products are pulled off the shelves and reduced.  • Maintains budgeted percentages related to sales, labor controls and shrink control.  • Maintains effective housekeeping program. Ensures compliance with all company policies that relate to the safety of associates and cleanliness and sanitation. Maintains and ensures compliance with local, state and government weights and measures and health department regulations.  • Greets and takes orders from customers while maintaining a positive and friendly attitude. Identifies areas in the Deli Department where improvement in customer service is required, then makes necessary changes to address these concerns. Instills a positive customer service image with all deli associates.  • Also performs duties of staff as required, insuring that all positions in de;o are covered on a daily basis.  • Note: This description represents a significant sampling of tasks performed, responsibilities and job knowledge required, however, it is not meant to be an exhaustive list.
