This includes providing updates to the Taproom Manager and/or including when appropriately. -Ensure lawful compliance and safety by making sure all customers consuming alcohol are of legal drinking age. -Follow alcohol awareness procedures for preventing intoxication and dealing with intoxicated guests.  ​Operations -Set up and clean up taproom operations and special events thoroughly and keep robust clean logs daily. -Maintain clean glassware through proper wash, rinse, and sanitize techniques. -Stock beer and retail merchandise in the taproom. -Ensure proper payment for all sales are collected and that the team of servers perform transaction handling procedures accurately. -Promote the sale of beer and non-beer products, including merchandise, sold in the taproom and promote  Atwater, the specials and upcoming events. -Assist the Taproom Manager with tracking sales and maintaining inventory, as well as identifying  discrepancies or shortages. -Ensure the point-of-sale and draft systems are operating optimally at all times. -Report all equipment problems, bar maintenance issues, violations or substandard practices to the  -Taproom Manager immediately upon encountering a problem. -Attend brewery staff meetings, as required. -Communicate with taproom staff and management to ensure guest satisfaction. ​  Other Duties -Represent Atwater and its brands in a professional and positive manner at all times, both inside and outside the brewery. -Serve as a favorable public image of the company by attending and participating in public events such as festivals and promotions, both on site and off site. -Demonstrate pride in serving the community and providing extraordinary customer experiences. -Comply with all company policies and procedures, as a condition of employment. -Perform all other job duties and functions that may be assigned. -Atwater reserves the right to change duties, responsibilities and activities at any time.  ​  Job Qualifications -Education -High school diploma or equivalent required; college degree preferred. -Possesses a TIPS certification or commits to obtaining one prior to starting the position.   Experience -Previous bartending/beertending experience required. -Brewery experience preferred. -Prior customer service or retail sales experience in the food or beverage industry a plus.   Other Credentials -Must be at least 18 years of age and have proof of eligibility to work in the United States.

Posting Title: HIRING COOKS / DISHWASHERS : $13-18/HR, $100 BONUS, RESPECT GIVEN!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Salt Springs Brewery in Saline is hiring Line Cooks, Prep Cooks, and Dishwashers. Join the BEST team in the business and work in the coolest venue around. Salt Springs runs an open kitchen with awesome views of the house. Bring your skills and energy to our house and we'll take great care of you!  Here's our offer: - $13 to $18 based on your abilities. Are you worth more than that? You need to show the Chef! - $100 BONUS after 2 solid weeks of great work! - We close between 8pm and 10pm every night so you're out early! We're also closed Monday's. - FREE PARKING.... you getting that perk in Ann Arbor?  - FREE shift meals ($20 max/day) It's like getting an additional $3 an hour! - An adult beverage after your shift. Great discounts on adult beverages after that. - 20% Discount on food and drink when you come in with friends or family. - A clean line, solid equipment, and friendly staff. - An easy 10 minute drive south from Ann Arbor. - Did I mention that we make the BEST beer you've ever tasted???  Here's what we need from you in return :  - Bring a passion for food, the skills to prepare it, and willingness to learn new things! - Solid understanding of grill, saute', or pizza station. The more stations you can cover, earns you more!  - Work clean and present dishes we can all be proud of.  - Be rock solid closing the line at night or opening it in the morning. - Stay on top of your work to keep the line moving, especially under pressure. - Ability to communicate with all stations to properly time food to the tables. - Help keep the dish room clean, organized, and moving. - Enjoy working in a fast paced environment where what you do actually matters. - Take pride in yourself and your work. We'll take care of you!  We look forward to hearing from you today. Respond to this ad or drop in and ask to speak with the GM or our Executive Chef. We're ready to hire you TODAY and show you what it means to work for an organization that actually cares about you. I look forward to talking with you today. Cheers!

QR Code Link to This Post   Merriment Ventures is looking for Amazing People to work closely with our Front of House (managers, servers, bartenders, hosts) + Back of House (Chefs, Dishwashers) teams to play a key role in making humans happy.  As a Front of House team member, you build genuine and authentic connections with every guest, either for one day or sometimes for a lifetime. You can instantly build rapport and make a difference in someone's life in just one interaction.  Growth Opportunities: - Learn the power of presence - Increase your effective listening skills - Multi-task and manage numerous relationships - Develop the initial skills for leadership: providing feedback, giving recognition, and asking thoughtful questions - Learn how to maintain work/life balance  Our People: We have Foodies, Video Game heroes, Movie Buffs, Musicians, Art lovers, Fitness fanatics, and every other variety of people. We have Family people, Single people, Funny people, Happy people. You will find friends here and we encourage you to bring your friends too.  Our Hiring Process: 1. You find or get sent this advertisement. 2. You read the ad. 3. It piques your interest. 4. You tell us you are interested (apply, email, shout, call). 5. We send you an invitation to come to hang out in our awesome restaurant and tell us more about yourself. 6. You meet the team in person. 7. You tell everyone how amazing your life has become. 8. Your friends come on over and join the fun.  Advice: Don't ignore this opportunity. If nothing else it will provide you the opportunity to meet some cool new folks in the industry.  One more thing: Don't worry about perfecting every detail of your resume! We’d rather get to know you in person anyway. Don't go press your pants or buy a suit! Don’t be sloppy, but dress comfortably, we want you to be YOU.  OK - Last Thing: If you are still scared or feel you don't have the qualifications. Apply anyway! We don't hire off of industry buzz words. We hire real living people who have voices and we want to hear. If you are smart you can learn what you need to.  P.S. - Share this! To be a successful member of the Sazama's service team, banquet/catering experience will be helpful but isn't required. Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   As part of Saz's Hospitality Group, Sazama's Fine Catering at Marcus Performing Arts Center prides itself on providing unexpectedly, over-the-top service to every guest, every time, at every event from black tie galas to corporate lunches to fairy tale weddings. Every day is a little different, but some of your duties will include:    Washing dishes, glassware, flatware, pots, pans, and utensils using a dishwasher or by hand;  Cleaning kitchen work areas, kitchen equipment, and the dish machine;  Setup and breakdown event spaces per our event requirements. Additionally, some culinary prep as required to support the team and provide unexpectedly over-the-top amazing customer service.   Sazama's Fine Catering offers competitive pay of no less than $14/hour for these team members. We can accommodate "sometimes" schedules and "all the time" schedules to fit your needs and ours. A variety of positions and shifts are available to meet your calendar. Members on this team will generally work 15-25 hours a week. The busiest times for us are Thursday-Tuesday, so weekend availability is important! Plus, after 90 days on our team, you'll get a $250 bonus! Posting Title: ► White Castle is now hiring Team Members!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Apply Now!  Job description You’re not looking for a job…you’re looking for a Certified™ Great Place to Work®! That’s us—over 100-year-old White Castle, America’s first fast food restaurant. You’re in luck because we’re looking for someone like you to help us create memorable moments—and The Original Slider®—for Craver Nation and beyond!   Pay is $15.00/hr.  No experience? No problem! We’ll teach you everything you need to know. Your outgoing, positive energy and friendliness are the not-so-secret ingredients for our successful #whitecastleteam. Your day-to-day responsibilities include customer service, working the cash register and drive-thru, preparing orders, maintaining sanitation, working the fryer/griddle and more!   Our fourth-generation family business leadership looks out for all team members just like—you guessed it—family! Team member safety, pandemic or not, is our highest priority. For more than a century, we’ve taken measures big and small to make sure our work environment is healthy, safe and promotes harmony between your time on and off the clock.  Here are some of the awesome benefits you get while working at White Castle: • Weekly pay • Free meals while working • Paid vacation • Medical, dental & life insurance • Weekly paychecks • 401K & profit sharing plans • Free uniforms • Scholarship eligibility • Promote from within • Community volunteerism • And more!  The eligibility for these benefits may vary by your average hours worked, location and length of service.  If you Crave a fun, great workplace with an over 100-year history of creating memorable moments for Cravers every day, look no further than our #whitecastleteam! APPLY NOW to complete our online application and assessment!  Requirements: • Must love to smile, laugh & have fun • Previous food service or management experience a bonus, but not required • Ability to stand for up to 8 hours during a shift & lift 30-50 lbs repeatedly • Enjoy working in a high energy, fast paced environment • Promote and drive the White Castle initiatives and increase brand loyalty • Must be a good person, a team player, and treat others with care and respect  About us: White Castle is serving up a steam-grilled opportunity to join our team where more than one in four have at least 10 years of consecutive service. We operate restaurants and stock retail freezers with products dedicated to satisfying your cravings morning, noon and night. All that’s missing is you. The Original Slider® was named in 2014 as Time magazine's "Most Influential Burger of All Time," and our Impossible ™ Slider was named by Thrillist in 2019 as the "Best Plant-Based Fast Food Burger." Fast Company named us one of the "10 Most Innovative Dining Companies" in 2021, our 100th year in business. And we’re a Certified™ Great Place to Work®.  White Castle supports vaccination initiatives to take a bite out of COVID-19 by encouraging all our new hires to get vaccinated. Your search ends here—we’ve got the career opportunity you Crave! Apply today, and Long Live Sliders™!  Complete the quick apply today and then follow the link to the White Castle online application. You must complete the White Castle online application to be considered for this position! We look forward to hearing from you!  White Castle is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Apply Now!

Manager will report directly to the owner. Management wage hourly plus tips and bonus.  Please email your resume.

Posting Title: ►► MEGA St. Louis Job Fair | Over 50 Companies Now Hiring!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Now's the time to get that Job! Tired of browsing online job boards all day? Come meet face-to-face with recruiters & hiring managers at the St. Louis Job Fair on November 10th.    Whether you’re looking for an entry-level or more experienced management job, this hiring event will have something for you. Get in before these positions fill up!   * Employers are hiring throughout the St. Louis metropolitan area.  When: Thursday, November 10th, 10am - 2pm  Where: Orlando's Event and Conference Centers, 2050 Dorsett Village, Maryland Heights, MO 63043  We encourage you to register online and upload your resume so that companies exhibiting at the job fair can access your information, increasing your employment opportunities! Click "reply" and we'll send you the event link to register.  Employers Include: 8th Avenue Foods and Provisions, Academy Air/Morrison Plumbing, Heating & Air Services, Allied OneSource​, ​Alro Steel, American Freedom Benefits, Bethesda Health Group, BioLife Plasma Services, Cambridge Air Solutions, Clarendale of St Peters, Clean - The Uniform Company, Commerce Bank St. Louis, Crossroads Courier, Deutsche Precision, Enterprise Fleet Management, Eye Care​ ​Partners/Clarkson Eyecare, FedEx Ground St Peters, First Community Credit Union, ​ ​Francis Howell School District, Friendship Village of St. Louis, Hawthorn Children’s​ ​Psychiatric Hospital, Hidden Valley Ski Resort, HMS Host, Human Resource Staffing, Labor Solutions, Legacy​ ​Pharmaceutical Packaging, Materialogic, McKesson Saint Louis Distribution Center, MTC, ​ ​Mills Properties, Miniature Market, Northstar Insurance Advisors, LLC, Oats Transportation St Louis, Pedestal Foods, PEG Staffing &​ ​Recruiting, Penske Saint Louis North Park, QPS Employment, Randstad RIS​, ​Renewal by Andersen, Reckitt (Formerly RB Manufacturing), RockIt Career Consultants, Rug Doctor, SA Recycling, Saint​ ​Louis County Department of Justice Services, Saint Louis Wholesale Tire, Southern Missouri Truck Driving School, Spectrum, State of Missouri/Department of Social Services, The International Institute, True Manufacturing Co., Inc, ​Urban League of Metropolitan St Louis LLC Head Start & EHS, US Army​, ​Valvoline, Waffle House, Westrock, and more...  Click here for the Event Directory listing all open positions!  Tips for Job Fair Success:  • Dress professionally as if attending a job interview  • Practice your personalized pitch which should summarize your skills and experience  • Make a good first – and lasting – impression with each recruiter  • Bring several copies of your updated resume or work history to the event   Parking and Admission are FREE!  *Registration is not require to attend.

QR Code Link to This Post   SAGE Dining Services® is seeking a Prep Cook/Line Server to join our team at a private day school in Gahanna. SAGE offers weekly pay, comprehensive year-round benefits, continuous training, and room for growth. If you are looking for a place to grow your food service career, this is the place to be! Monday through Friday daytime hours, located close to the bus line.   Schedule:      Monday through Friday     7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.     Summer programs available     Overtime available for catering, with prior notice  Pay Type:   $16.00 Hourly Time Commitment:   Full Time What you'll get:      Benefits for full-time positions.     Paid time off.     Competitive wages paid weekly.     Ongoing training.     Career growth opportunities.     Mission based company with values you trust.     Uniforms and shoes provided.  What you'll do:      Ensure that all food is appropriately displayed and visually appealing.     Interact cheerfully with SAGE guests and Team Members and provide service with a smile.     Prepare assigned menu items in strict accordance with SAGE recipes.     Clean, restock, and replenish serving lines and stations to ensure our guests enjoy amazing dining experiences.     Clean all work areas and customer service areas on an ongoing basis.     Use proper food handling, storage, and sanitation techniques always (HACCP).     Assist in training new culinary Team Members.     Endure exposure to extreme temperatures; intense heat and freezing cold.     Adapt to additional duties as assigned by management.   What you'll need:      Experience as a Prep Cook or Cook preferred, but not required.     Ability to understand and execute recipes and instructions in detail.     Ability to properly set up a buffet or serving station.     Experience in customer service strongly preferred, but not required.     Food safety certifications as required by jurisdiction.  Working for SAGE means being part of a community. You’d work alongside creative, enthusiastic Team Members who share your passion for culinary excellence. You’d also make a difference in an academic community and bring excitement to the dining hall with made-from-scratch, Chef-inspired recipes that delight students, faculty, staff, and parents.  SAGE embraces the uniqueness of everyone in our family: Team Members, suppliers, guests, and client communities. Our diversity fuels our innovation, which drives our growth. Every voice matters.  Guided by our founding principles of respect and partnership, we offer fulfilling careers for Team Members, market access for small local suppliers, and a joyful celebration of inclusiveness and multiculturalism through the fresh, authentic, and yummy foods we serve.   Positions at SAGE provide competitive wages and benefits, with hours that offer a better work-life balance than those at a restaurant. We create careers, not just jobs, with significant opportunity for growth and promotion. Team Members learn SAGE Standards and enhance their skill set through extensive training in food safety, allergen awareness, and preventing eating disorders.  SAGE has enjoyed steady, organic growth for the past 30 years, and we now serve independent schools and private colleges across North America. We continue to grow and raise the bar in food service for the educational market to create exceptional dining experiences that delight the senses, inspire minds, and foster community. Come, rise with us!  Successful final candidates for the position may be required to fulfill location-specific health and safety requirements.    This job advertisement should not be misconstrued as an offer of employment or a comprehensive listing of position responsibilities/expectations.  Equal Opportunity Employer.

QR Code Link to This Post   Hey, we are The Pasta Bowl. We are looking for 2-3 people to join our team as cashiers. Cashiers typically earn between $15-20/hour including tips ($15.40 minimum guaranteed). Posting Title: Dish Washer / Light Prep For Immediate Hire
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Bang Bang Pie & Biscuit shop (an award winning brunch restaurant & pie bakery in Logan Square, Chicago) is currently seeking a Dishwasher (with light Prep duties) for immediate hire. We currently operate during day & early evening hours so rarely will there be late nights (done by 7 weeknights & 4:15 on weekends!) Earn up to $20+/ hr with hourly compensation plus proportionate share of pooled gratuities. Free shift meal daily plus free coffee & opportunities to try all of the items we serve, specials & pies on the menu.   Position Summary: The dish and general utility position is responsible for maintaining cleanliness and sanitation standards for our service ware, tableware, cooking utensils, cooking pots & pans etc., using manual & machine cleaning methods. This position also ensures the dishwashing area is maintained as a clean, safe and sanitary facility.  Major Responsibilities: Primary duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: • Sort and rinse dirty dishes, glass, tableware and other cooking utensils and manually wash or place them in racks to send through dish machine. • Sort and stack clean dishes. Carries clean dishes to cook’s line and other proper storage areas. Rewashes soiled dishes before delivering. • Wash pots, pans and trays by hand. • Remove trash and garbage to dumpster. • Set up or break down dishwashing area. • Fill/empty soak tubs / 3-basin sinks with cleaning/sanitizing solutions. • Sweep/mop floors. • General restaurant and restroom cleaning as directed. • Wipe up any spills to ensure kitchen floors remain dry • Must notify Manager anytime dish machine wash or rinse cycle falls below safety standard temperatures. • Other duties as directed. Essential Physical Requirements: Estimated percentage of daily physical requirements and/or number of pounds that may need to be lifted on the job. • Walks and stands during entire shift. • Lift and carry racks or stacks of dishes, glassware and other utensils, weighing up to 30 lbs., up to 50 times per shift.  As a member of the Bang Bang team you will be required to: - Work in a fast-paced, team oriented environment - Have opportunities to grow and exhibit your personal passions - Receive competitive compensation - Bring people joy and help build community  Dishwashers will be expected to: - Uphold sanitation and cleanliness standards - Be a team player, lend a helping hand where needed - Not afraid to show off your strength (be able to lift and move up to 50 pounds)  - weekends required

QR Code Link to This Post   BAR MANAGER   JOB DESCRIPTION  The Bar Manager assists the General Manager in coordinating day to day bar and business operations and sales functions of the restaurant. The Bar Manager works with and as directed by the General Manager to execute plans for the bar and restaurant. This position is responsible for thorough planning, delegation, coordination of staffing, organization, decision making, and executing plans to achieve desirable sales and profit results. The Bar Manager takes ownership of creating an environment where all feel welcome and valued. The Bar Manager assists staff in our mission to cultivate positive and lasting relationships through the celebration of food, drink and Midwestern Hospitality, guaranteeing big smiles all around.    ESSENTIAL DUTIES   Works as directed by the General manager,  in conjunction with with the management team to:  Support and maintain their team through coaching and mentoring for staff growth and development across all positions.   Executes all functions of the Bartender Job description and holds staff accountable for doing the same  Establish and maintain proper systems and procedures ensuring accurate and complete opening, closing, and cleaning procedures are in place to maintain a successful bar.   Execute timely, complete and accurate ordering to control spending while maintaining sufficient stock of all items prepped or purchased offered on the menu. The expectation is that all items on the menu remain in stock.   Ensure proper production, labeling and rotation of all prepared and purchased products in accordance with expected business volume, shelf life and health ordinances.   Maintain high standards and organized and effective systems for training.   Hold staff accountable for performance and productivity while maintaining a positive and pleasant work environment.   Lead by example in all aspects of service and hospitality both on the floor and behind closed doors.  Maintain high production, productivity, quality and service standards.  Organize and supervise successful shifts ensuring proper staffing and execution.   Deliver superior food and beverage service for maximum guest satisfaction.   Uphold existing policies, and high standards, working to make adjustments when and where needed; offer suggestions for improvement.  Order supplies with fiscal responsibility in mind; maintain costs as specified in the budget . Effectively communicates financial needs to KM, GM and ownership in a timely manner.  Execute responsible cash handling policies and procedures, holding staff accountable for the same.   Implement and follow all pertinent legal and regulatory requirements as they pertain to the health and safety of our staff and guests.   Uphold all rules and standards of conduct laid out in the Goodbrothers Hospitality Team Member Handbook equitably for all employees. Follows proper protocol and accurately documents all guest or employee issues in a timely manner; effectively communicating with the senior leadership team when necessary.  Available and able to work all shifts in the restaurant as scheduled to meet the needs of the business; available to troubleshoot and answer questions off-duty as they pertain to the successful management of the bar.   Incorporates Goodbrothers Hospitality core values and mission into the daily management structure and execution of operations.  SKILLS + QUALIFICATIONS  2+ years of experience in restaurant operations  Demonstrated growth in leadership among peers Extensive food, beverage and Restaurant Industry knowledge Experience in a high volume setting; ability to excel under pressure Results driven Self-motivated  Willingness to learn and grow Able to motivate and inspire others Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Creative problem-solving ability Positivity

QR Code Link to This Post   Tired of the job you've got, or are you waking up every day dreading the drive to a job you know is going to ruin your day? Hating that gig where you're on your feet all day, in a hot building, maybe dealing with people who don't care about you or actively enjoy making you miserable? Tired of working for people who talk down to you and customers who couldn't be bothered to give you even the basic level of respect or human decency?  Well, I get the feeling that we can help each other out. You're someone who isn't dumb, someone who, when they're given a task that they care about, they make sure to do a good job, and you're hopefully someone who's willing to try something they might not have any experience in. We're Kar-Tech, a manufacturer that specializes in wireless control systems, a company that is growing like mad and needs folks to help us meet all that demand, and a company that's been around for over 25 years and has employees that have been with us almost that entire time (and who's going to stick with a job that long if the folks they work for suck, right?)  We're looking for folks to help us with Light Assembly, Kitting/Receiving, and Electrical testing. We know not everyone out there has years of experience soldering tiny components, finding parts to go with jobs, or creating wiring harnesses, and that's totally fine. If you can promise us you'll show up every day, willing to learn and eager to show you care about your work, we can teach you all the skills you need. And we're going to go way out of our way to make it super clear we're happy you keep coming back.  The mantra we work with is if you can come in every day and show us that you care about the work you're doing, we can make sure you learn the skills to absolutely kick ass here.  So here's those nitty gritty details that really matter. We're located in Delafield, and our production floor runs from 7 AM - 3:30 PM, Monday through Friday. We won't hire anyone for less than $15/hr, but if you've got the skills or experience to merit it, we're willing to go above that, potentially way above it, and even if you don't odds are you won't be making $15 for long. We've got medical, dental, vacation, 401k match, all that jazz, hell we even get pizza or bagels every other Friday or so.

Posting Title: 🎉White Castle is growing their team in Chicago!
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   White Castle is growing their team in Chicago    Who Are We? White Castle has a hot and tasty opportunity on the menu with this chance to join a team where more than one in four have at least 10 years of consecutive service. We operate restaurants and stock retail freezers with products dedicated to satisfying your cravings morning, noon and night. All that’s missing is you. Our Original Slider® was named in 2014 as Time magazine's "Most Influential Burger of All Time," and our Impossible ™ Slider was named by Thrillist in 2019 as the "Best Plant-Based Fast Food Burger." Fast Company named us one of the "10 Most Innovative Dining Companies" in 2021, our 100th year in business. And we’re a Certified™ Great Place to Work®. White Castle supports vaccination initiatives to take a bite out of COVID-19 by encouraging all our new hires to get vaccinated. Your search ends here—we’ve got the career opportunity you Crave! Apply today, and Long Live Sliders™! Who Are We Looking For? Team Member You’re not looking for a job…you’re looking for a Certified™ Great Place to Work®! That’s us—over 100-year-old White Castle, America’s first fast food restaurant. You’re in luck because we’re looking for someone like you to help us create memorable moments—and The Original Slider®—for Craver Nation and beyond! No experience? No problem! We’ll teach you everything you need to know. Your outgoing, positive energy and friendliness are the not-so-secret ingredients for our successful #whitecastleteam. Your day-to-day responsibilities include customer service, working the cash register and drive-thru, preparing orders, maintaining sanitation, working the fryer/griddle and more! Our fourth-generation family business leadership looks out for all team members just like—you guessed it—family! Team member safety, pandemic or not, is our highest priority. For more than a century, we’ve taken measures big and small to make sure our work environment is healthy, safe and promotes harmony between your time on and off the clock.Late Night Perks! Earn an extra $2 an hour from 10pm – 6am (Limited time offer)Here’s some of the awesome benefits you get while working at White Castle (the eligibility for which may vary by your average hours worked, location and length of service).•Weekly pay•Free meals while working•Paid vacation•Medical, dental & life insurance•Weekly paychecks•401K & profit sharing plans•Free uniforms•Scholarship eligibility•Promote from within practice•Community volunteerism•And more!!If you Crave a fun, great workplace with an over 100-year history of creating memorable moments for Cravers every day, look no further than our #whitecastleteam! APPLY NOW to complete our online application and assessment!Long Live Loving Work! Long Live White Castle! Long Live Sliders™!      Come join our team today!

QR Code Link to This Post   ARAMARK IS NOW HIRING FOR KITCHEN WORKER(S)!!!!   The Corrections Kitchen Worker supervises inmates to ensure that meal and food items are prepared in accordance with production plans. In this role, you will train workers in methods of performing duties, as well as assign and coordinate work to promote the efficiency of operations. This person is also responsible for the sanitation of the facility and maintaining personal safety, by conforming to all standards and regulations. Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:   •    Adhere to and maintain preparation and production guidelines according to Aramark standards by reviewing and approving production and temperature logs. •    Supervise inmates in food preparation and tray assembly.  •    Ensure timely, efficient meal service and all Aramark guidelines are being met.  •    Participate in preparation and serving of meals •    Prints and distribute recipes.  •    Direct inmates in the use of Aramark recipes and train on proper cooking procedures.  •    Ensure proper portions and any special dietary requirements are fulfilled.   •    Obtain accurate daily population counts and review with staff.  •    Adhere to security policies and procedures. Ensure storage areas are locked at all times.  •    Ensure that all kitchen tools and equipment are returned to their designated secure area. Ensure all keys are returned and secured.  •    Determines work procedures, prepares work schedules and sanitation schedules while ensuring that cooks, inmates and/or food service workers adhere to the assigned schedule. •    Assist in conducting inventory, properly receiving, and storing food and food related items. Requisition orders as needed for approval. •    Participates in the preparation/5 P’s (Participation, Pulls, Production, Portion Control, and Postproduction), storage and assembly of meals and food items.  •    Follows the Company’s Standard of Operation for food handling and storage. Follows HACCP policies and procedures regarding proper food handling procedures.    At Aramark, developing new skills and doing what it takes to get the job done make a positive impact for our employees and for our customers. In order to meet our commitments, job duties may change or new ones may be assigned without formal notice.  QUALIFICATIONS:   •    Must be over 18 years of age   •    Minimum of one (1) year of food prep or related work preferred •    Previous supervisory experience preferred •    Previous experience interacting with inmates a plus •    Ability to motivate and supervise inmates and/or team members to attain quality and quantity of food production in a correctional work environment •    Must be able to obtain a food safety certification •    Ability to work independently with limited supervision •    Ability to exercise good judgment and tact •    Must be able to follow basic safety procedures and policies •    Must qualify for and maintain correctional facility security clearance  This role may have physical demands including, but not limited to, lifting, bending, pushing, pulling and/or extended walking and standing. review and posting, through resume screening, initial interview, additional steps and candidate communications Serve as subject matter expert for questions, changes or needs in Paylocity HRIS and DFInTime systems, including database maintenance as needed and operating as primary contact with vendors to resolve issues Develop and deliver on-going training to team, department and area leaders on Qualifications  •	High School Diploma or equivalent. •	An understanding of baking techniques. •	Good communication skills, time planning and resource management. •	Attention to detail, especially when performing quality inspections on ingredients and products. •	Basic math and computer skills. •	Willingness to work independently or with other team members to solve problems, plan schedules, fulfill orders, and create delicious baked goods. •	Ability to work in hot, hectic environment, stand, walk, bend, use hands and appliances, and lift heavy items for extended periods. Posting Title: BOCA is looking for a Line Cook

Posting Title: Pizza Maker - dinner shifts at Glass Nickel Pizza Co
Posting Text: QR Code Link to This Post   Click here to apply! Short & Sweet version- Come make great food with people you like to work with! Depending on availability and under or over 30 hour status, make $15-16 to start with chance for raise in first 4 weeks. Opportunities to learn on the job and move up Having a respectful, fun team that makes you happy to come to work is super important to all of us. apply today and schedule an interview online details below! POSITION SUMMARY: GNP cooks are responsible for preparing food dishes according to established recipes, keeping fresh food items in rotation, cleaning, and having positive interactions with co-workers. We want to be the BEST in Madison, how about you!?! Shift: For Dinner Rush/Nights, Weekend availability needed Part-Time: Rate of pay: $15.00 - $16 per hour $13.50 for under 18 with no kitchen experience Full-Time: Rate of pay: $15.00 - $16 per hour starting, 1-month review and potential for $1/hour raise up to $17 per hour based on speed of learning, enthusiasm, reliability $13.50 for under 18 with no kitchen experience BENEFITS:  Referral Program Employee Discount 2 Free GNP T-shirt at hire. At cost for any extras wanted Full-Time Benefits Eligible Employees- health insurance, dental insurance, long-term disability, life insurance & other add-on plans Health, Dental eligibility. Add On insurance available  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Prepare a variety of dishes ranging from pizzas, calzones, and appetizers using specific methods, procedures, and recipes Prepare dishes by cooking in ovens, fryers, open flame burners, microwaves, and a variety of kitchen equipment, including a Hobart mixer, large hand mixer, dough ball rounder, and pizza oven Assume responsibility for the quality of products served Comply consistently with standard portion sizes, cooking methods, quality standards, and kitchen rules, policies, and procedures Stock and maintain sufficient levels of food products at line stations to assure a smooth service  Portion food products prior to cooking according to standard portion size and recipe specifications Read tickets and fulfill orders with no less than 99% accuracy Handle, store and rotate all products properly Assist in food prep assignments during off-peak periods as needed Perform related duties such as helping to wash dishes as needed, preparing recycling and cleaning around the kitchen Maintain cleanliness and sanitation at all times; perform open and closing duties Uphold company safety and sanitation requirements to ensure the health and safety of our guests and employees  QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS:  Kitchen experience a plus Possess the ethics and positive attitude that support our values and culture Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and organize High personal standards for quality and service Personable and able to communicate effectively Must have a working phone Punctual Available for nights, weekends, and holidays  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:  Must be at least 18 years of age for $15 starting wage and to work with certain equipment  ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL FUNCTIONS:  Ability to stand/walk for 8 hours per day. Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 lbs. Will frequently bend, stand, reach, stoop, lift and carry Must be able to work in both warm and cool environments Must be able to tolerate higher levels of noise from music and customer traffic Must be able to tolerate potential allergens: eggs, dairy, gluten, and soy  Click here to apply!
